examples.title: Basic Text Input with Validation
examples.description: Simple text input with label, placeholder, and error state
examples.code:
<InBasicTextInput
  id="username"
  name="username"
  label-text="Username"
  placeholder-text="Enter your username"
  v-model="username"
  :states="usernameError ? 'error' : 'default'"
  :state-message="usernameError"
  helper-message="3-20 characters, letters and numbers only"
  :max-character-length="20"
  :character-counter-status="true"
/>

examples.title: Number Input with Range Validation
examples.description: Number input with min/max limits and decimal support
examples.code:
<InBasicTextInput
  id="price"
  name="price"
  type="number"
  label-text="Product Price"
  placeholder-text="0.00"
  v-model="price"
  :prefix-status="true"
  prefix-text="$"
  :allow-decimal="true"
  :allow-comma="true"
  :min-value="0"
  :max-value="999999"
  helper-message="Enter price in USD"
/>

examples.title: Search Input with Icon
examples.description: Text input with search icon and clear button
examples.code:
<InBasicTextInput
  id="search"
  name="search"
  placeholder-text="Search products..."
  v-model="searchQuery"
  :left-icon-status="true"
  left-icon-name="search"
  :right-icon-status="!!searchQuery"
  right-icon-name="x"

  @enter="performSearch"
/>

examples.title: Currency Input with Dropdown
examples.description: Number input with actionable currency prefix selector
examples.code:
<InBasicTextInput
  id="amount"
  name="amount"
  type="number"
  label-text="Amount"
  placeholder-text="0.00"
  v-model="amount"
  :prefix-status="true"
  :actionable-prefix-status="true"
  :prefix-dropdown-options="[
    { text: 'USD ($)', value: 'usd' },
    { text: 'EUR (€)', value: 'eur' },

/>

examples.title: Password Input with Toggle
examples.description: Password field with visibility toggle icon
examples.code:
<InBasicTextInput
  id="password"
  name="password"
  :type="showPassword ? 'text' : 'password'"
  label-text="Password"
  placeholder-text="Enter password"
  v-model="password"
  auto-complete="current-password"
  :right-icon-status="true"
  :right-icon-name="showPassword ? 'eye-off' : 'eye'"
  @right-icon-click="showPassword = !showPassword"
  helper-message="Min 8 characters, 1 uppercase, 1 number"
  :states="passwordError ? 'error' : 'default'"
  :state-message="passwordError"
/>

examples.title: Weight Input with Unit Selector
examples.description: Number input with actionable unit suffix dropdown
examples.code:
<InBasicTextInput
  id="weight"
  name="weight"
  type="number"
  label-text="Weight"
  placeholder-text="0"
  v-model="weight"
  :suffix-status="true"
  :actionable-suffix-status="true"
  :suffix-dropdown-options="[
    { text: 'kg', value: 'kg' },
    { text: 'lb', value: 'lb' },
    { text: 'g', value: 'g' }
  ]"
  :allow-decimal="true"
  :min-value="0"
  @suffix-click="handleUnitChange"
/>

commonMistakes.mistake: Using states='error' without stateMessage
commonMistakes.impact: User sees red border but doesn't know what's wrong
commonMistakes.fix: Always provide state-message when using error/warning/success states

commonMistakes.mistake: Using minValue/maxValue with type='text'
commonMistakes.impact: Validation doesn't work - these only apply to number inputs
commonMistakes.fix: Ensure type="number" when using min-value or max-value props

commonMistakes.mistake: Setting actionablePrefixStatus without prefixDropdownOptions
commonMistakes.impact: Dropdown appears empty or non-functional
commonMistakes.fix: Always provide :prefix-dropdown-options array when actionable-prefix-status is true

commonMistakes.mistake: Disabling preventXss without server-side validation
commonMistakes.impact: Critical security vulnerability - allows XSS attacks
commonMistakes.fix: Keep prevent-xss="true" (default) unless you have robust server validation

commonMistakes.mistake: Using autoFocus on multiple inputs
commonMistakes.impact: Focus conflict - unpredictable behavior, only last one gets focus
commonMistakes.fix: Only use auto-focus on ONE input per page/modal

commonMistakes.mistake: Setting maxCharacterLength without characterCounterStatus
commonMistakes.impact: Limit enforced silently - user doesn't see character count
commonMistakes.fix: Enable character-counter-status when using max-character-length for better UX

commonMistakes.mistake: Forgetting to handle @enter event for search inputs
commonMistakes.impact: User must click search button, can't use Enter key
commonMistakes.fix: Add @enter handler for search and form submission use cases

commonMistakes.mistake: Using allowDecimal with integer-only scenarios
commonMistakes.impact: Users can enter decimals where not appropriate (age, count)
commonMistakes.fix: Set :allow-decimal="false" for quantities, ages, counts

valueFormat.notes: Input content with two-way binding support. For text inputs use string, for number inputs use number. When type='number', value is automatically parsed to number. Use v-model for reactive binding. Listen to @input for real-time changes or @change for committed changes.
valueFormat.example:
v-model="username" // For text
v-model="age" // For number input

valueFormat.notes: Determines input behavior and validation. 'text' (default) for general text, 'number' for numeric values with min/max validation. When 'number', shows spinner controls in some browsers and validates numeric format. Use with allowDecimal and allowComma for number formatting.

Controls the visual appearance and color scheme of the input. Default is 'grey'. Theme affects border color, background, and hover states. Use consistent theme across related form elements for visual coherence.

Visual feedback for validation status. 'default' (neutral), 'success' (green, valid), 'warning' (yellow, caution), 'error' (red, invalid). Changes border color and shows stateMessage. Use with stateMessage to explain the state. Critical for form validation UX.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using states prop without stateMessage
commonMistakes.impact: User sees error styling but no explanation why
commonMistakes.fix: Always provide state-message when states is 'error', 'warning', or 'success'

valueFormat.notes: Explanation text shown below input when states is set to error/warning/success. Critical for accessibility - screen readers announce this message. Keep messages concise but informative. Examples: 'Email is required', 'Password must be 8+ characters', 'Username is available'.

Shows text or icon before the input field. Used for currency symbols ($, €), units (kg, cm), or context indicators. When true, displays prefixText value. For interactive prefix, use actionablePrefixStatus with prefixDropdownOptions.

Text displayed before input when prefixStatus=true. Common uses: currency symbols ($, €, £), percentage (%), units (kg, m, cm), protocol (https://). Keep short (1-4 characters). For dynamic/selectable prefix, use actionablePrefixStatus instead.

Converts prefix into an interactive dropdown selector. Requires prefixDropdownOptions to define available choices. Use for: currency switcher ($, €, £), unit selector (kg, lb), protocol picker (http://, https://). Emits @prefixClick with selected value.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using actionablePrefixStatus without prefixDropdownOptions
commonMistakes.impact: Dropdown is empty or shows default placeholder
commonMistakes.fix: Always provide :prefix-dropdown-options array when actionablePrefixStatus is true

valueFormat.notes: Dropdown options when actionablePrefixStatus=true. Each option needs 'text' (display) and 'value' (selected value). Optional 'selectionType' for single/multi select. Example use cases: currency selector, unit converter, protocol picker. Listen to @prefixClick to get selected value.
valueFormat.typescript: Array<{ text: string; value: string | number; selectionType?: 'single' | 'multi' }>

valueFormat.notes: Shows text or icon after the input field. Common uses: units (kg, pixels, %), clear button, search icon. When true, displays suffixText value. For interactive suffix (like clear button), use actionableSuffixStatus with suffixDropdownOptions.

Text displayed after input when suffixStatus=true. Common uses: measurement units (px, kg, cm), percentage (%), rate indicators (/month). Keep concise. For clickable actions (clear, search), use actionableSuffixStatus instead.

Converts suffix into an interactive dropdown or button. Requires suffixDropdownOptions. Use for: unit selector (kg/lb/g), clear button, action triggers. More common than actionablePrefix. Emits @suffixClick with selected value or action.

Dropdown options when actionableSuffixStatus=true. Each option needs 'text' (display) and 'value'. Common patterns: unit converter (kg→lb), time selector (minutes/hours), clear action. Listen to @suffixClick to handle selection.
valueFormat.typescript: Array<{ text: string; value: string | number; selectionType?: 'single' | 'multi' }>

leftIconStatus.description: Show icon on left side of input

valueFormat.notes: Displays icon before input text (after prefix if exists). Common uses: search icon, user icon, lock icon for password. When true, shows leftIconName icon. Icon is clickable and emits @leftIconClick. Use for visual context or actions.

Icon identifier from Design System icon library. Default is 'search'. Common icons: 'search', 'user', 'mail', 'lock', 'phone'. Icon becomes clickable button when leftIconStatus=true. Emits @leftIconClick when clicked. Check icon library for available names.
valueFormat.example:
left-icon-name="user" // User icon
left-icon-name="mail" // Email icon

rightIconStatus.description: Show icon on right side of input

valueFormat.notes: Displays icon after input text (before suffix if exists). More common than leftIcon. Common uses: password visibility toggle, clear button, info tooltip, validation checkmark. When true, shows rightIconName icon. Clickable with @rightIconClick event.

Icon identifier from Design System. Default is 'search'. Common icons: 'eye'/'eye-off' (password toggle), 'x' (clear), 'check' (valid), 'info' (help). Icon is interactive button that emits @rightIconClick. More commonly used than leftIcon for actions.
valueFormat.example:
right-icon-name="eye" // Password visibility
right-icon-name="x" // Clear button

valueFormat.notes: Maximum allowed characters for text input. Enforces hard limit - prevents typing beyond this length. Shows character counter when characterCounterStatus=true. Use for: tweets (280), SMS (160), usernames (50), short descriptions (500). Returns 0 when limit reached.

commonMistakes.mistake: Setting maxCharacterLength without characterCounterStatus
commonMistakes.impact: Limit enforced but user doesn't see remaining characters
commonMistakes.fix: Enable character-counter-status when using max-character-length for better UX

valueFormat.notes: Displays 'X / Y' character count below input. Works with maxCharacterLength (shows '45 / 280') or characterCounterMaxValue. Essential for inputs with length limits like tweets, SMS, bios. Updates in real-time as user types. Turns red when approaching limit.

characterCounterMaxValue.description: Max value for character counter display

valueFormat.notes: Sets the denominator in character counter (X / Y). Default is 20. Use when you want to show counter without enforcing maxCharacterLength limit. Shows visual feedback but doesn't prevent typing beyond limit. Prefer maxCharacterLength for hard limits.

Minimum acceptable value when type='number'. Prevents submission/validation below this value. Default is 0. Use for: age (18+), quantity (1+), price (0+), percentage (0-100). Validation happens on blur/change, not during typing. Shows error state when violated.

Maximum acceptable value when type='number'. Prevents values exceeding this limit. Use with minValue for range validation. Examples: percentage (0-100), age (18-120), discount (0-99). Validation on blur. Shows error state when exceeded.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using minValue/maxValue on text type input
commonMistakes.impact: Validation doesn't work - only applies to type="number"
commonMistakes.fix: Ensure type="number" when using min-value or max-value

allowDecimal.description: Allow decimal numbers in number input

valueFormat.notes: When true, permits decimal point in number inputs (3.14, 99.99). When false, only integers allowed. Use for: prices ($9.99), measurements (5.5kg), percentages (33.33%). Works only with type='number'. Decimal separator is '.' (period).

When true (default), permits comma as thousand separator in numbers (1,000,000). Improves readability for large numbers. When false, commas are blocked. Works with type='number'. Common in prices, populations, counts. Format: 1,234,567.89

When true (default), sanitizes input to prevent XSS attacks. Strips/escapes dangerous characters like <script>, HTML tags, JavaScript event handlers. CRITICAL for security when displaying user input. Only disable in controlled environments. Sanitization happens on input event.

commonMistakes.mistake: Disabling preventXss without proper server-side validation
commonMistakes.impact: Security vulnerability - allows XSS attacks
commonMistakes.fix: Keep prevent-xss="true" unless you have robust server-side sanitization

valueFormat.notes: HTML autocomplete attribute for browser autofill. 'off' (default) disables autocomplete. Use specific values for better UX: 'name', 'email', 'username', 'current-password', 'new-password', 'tel', 'address-line1', 'postal-code', 'cc-number'. Improves form filling speed.
valueFormat.example:
auto-complete="email" // Email autofill
auto-complete="current-password" // Password manager
auto-complete="off" // Disable

valueFormat.notes: When true, automatically focuses this input when component mounts. Use sparingly - only for primary action inputs (search box, login form). Multiple autoFocus can cause focus conflicts. Improves UX by reducing clicks. Not recommended for mobile due to keyboard pop-up.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using autoFocus on multiple inputs
commonMistakes.impact: Focus conflict - unpredictable which input gets focus
commonMistakes.fix: Only use auto-focus on ONE input per page/form

valueFormat.notes: When true (default), displays helperMessage text below input. Use for: format hints ('MM/DD/YYYY'), examples ('john@example.com'), instructions ('8-20 characters'). Different from stateMessage which shows errors. Helper is always visible, state appears on validation.

Instructional text shown below input when helperMessageStatus=true. Guides users on expected format/content. Examples: 'Your email will not be shared', 'Min 8 characters with 1 number', '(555) 123-4567 format'. Keep concise. Shows in neutral gray color.

When true, displays animated skeleton placeholder instead of input. Use during data loading or async operations. Maintains layout while content loads. Better UX than spinners for form fields. Automatically hides when loading completes.

Defines skeleton loader dimensions. Object with 'width' and 'height' properties (numbers or strings with units). Default matches input size. Use to prevent layout shift during loading. Only applies when skeletonStatus=true.
valueFormat.typescript: { width?: number | string; height?: number | string; }

change.description: Emitted when input loses focus with changed value

enter.description: Emitted when Enter key is pressed

leftIconClick.description: Emitted when left icon is clicked

rightIconClick.description: Emitted when right icon is clicked

prefixClick.description: Emitted when actionable prefix is clicked

suffixClick.description: Emitted when actionable suffix is clicked

// Returns: true

helperFunctions.name: sanitizeInput
helperFunctions.description: Remove potentially dangerous characters for XSS prevention

bestPractices.practice: Always pair validation states with messages
bestPractices.description: Provide clear stateMessage for error/warning/success states
Show expected format before user makes mistakes

bestPractices.practice: Enable character counter for length-limited inputs
bestPractices.description: Show remaining characters for tweets, SMS, bios
Improve UX with browser autofill for common fields
bestPractices.example:
auto-complete="email" // For email inputs
auto-complete="current-password" // For passwords

bestPractices.description: Use type='number' with min/max for numeric inputs
Security first - only disable with strong justification

performanceNotes.description: Frequent validation on every keystroke can impact performance
performanceNotes.recommendation: Use debouncing for expensive validation operations (API calls, complex regex). Validate on @blur for simple client-side checks, @input with debounce for async validation

performanceNotes.description: Many InBasicTextInput instances can slow rendering
performanceNotes.recommendation: Use v-if to conditionally render sections, implement virtual scrolling for 50+ inputs, lazy-load validation rules

performanceNotes.description: Large dropdown option lists can delay interaction
performanceNotes.recommendation: Limit dropdown options to 10-15 items, use searchable dropdown for larger lists, consider separate selector for 20+ options

accessibilityNotes.description: All inputs must have associated labels for screen readers
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Always provide labelText prop. If visual label is not desired, use aria-label attribute
accessibilityNotes.example:
label-text="Email Address" // Visible label
aria-label="Search query" // Invisible label

accessibilityNotes.description: Validation errors must be announced to screen readers
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Component automatically adds aria-describedby linking to stateMessage. Ensure stateMessage is provided when states='error'
accessibilityNotes.example:
:states="'error'"
state-message="Email is required" // Announced to screen readers

accessibilityNotes.description: Enable browser autofill for better accessibility and UX
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Use autoComplete prop with standard values: 'email', 'name', 'tel', 'current-password', 'new-password', etc.

accessibilityNotes.description: All interactive elements must be keyboard accessible
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Component handles Tab/Shift+Tab navigation. For actionable prefix/suffix, ensure @prefixClick/@suffixClick handlers work with Enter/Space keys
accessibilityNotes.example: // Component automatically handles keyboard for dropdowns

basicTextInput.title: Basic Text Input with Validation
basicTextInput.description: Standard text input with validation states and messages
basicTextInput.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';
import { InBasicTextInput } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const email = ref('');
const emailError = ref('');

const emailState = computed(() => {
  if (!email.value) return 'default';
  return emailError.value ? 'error' : 'success';
});

const validateEmail = () => {
  if (!email.value.includes('@')) {
    emailError.value = 'Please enter a valid email';
  } else {
    emailError.value = '';
  }
};
</script>

<template>
  <InBasicTextInput
    id="email"
    v-model="email"
    label-text="Email"
    placeholder="you@example.com"
    :states="emailState"
    :state-message="emailError"
    auto-complete="email"
    @blur="validateEmail"
  />
</template>

actionablePrefix.title: Input with Selectable Prefix
actionablePrefix.description: Currency input with dropdown prefix selector
actionablePrefix.code:
<script setup>
import { ref } from 'vue';
import { InBasicTextInput } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const amount = ref('');
const selectedCurrency = ref('$');

const currencyOptions = [
  { label: 'USD ($)', value: '$' },
  { label: 'EUR (€)', value: '€' },
  { label: 'GBP (£)', value: '£' }
];

const handlePrefixClick = (currency) => {
  selectedCurrency.value = currency;
};
</script>

<template>
  <InBasicTextInput
    id="amount"
    v-model="amount"
    label-text="Amount"
    type="number"
    :prefix-status="true"
    :prefix-text="selectedCurrency"
    :actionable-prefix-status="true"
    :prefix-dropdown-options="currencyOptions"
    @prefixClick="handlePrefixClick"
  />
</template>

cssVariables.--text-input-focus-border: Border color when focused (default: primary color)

styling.notes: Use CSS variables for consistent theming across inputs. The component automatically applies state classes for styling feedback.

implementationPatterns.name: Form Validation Pattern
implementationPatterns.description: Real-time validation with debounced API checks
implementationPatterns.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, watch } from 'vue';
import { debounce } from 'lodash-es';

const username = ref('');
const usernameState = ref('default');
const usernameMessage = ref('');

const checkUsername = debounce(async (value) => {
  if (!value) {
    usernameState.value = 'default';
    return;
  }
  
  try {
    const available = await api.checkUsername(value);
    if (available) {
      usernameState.value = 'success';
      usernameMessage.value = 'Username is available';
    } else {
      usernameState.value = 'error';
      usernameMessage.value = 'Username is already taken';
    }
  } catch (error) {
    usernameState.value = 'error';
    usernameMessage.value = 'Failed to validate username';
  }
}, 500);

watch(username, checkUsername);
</script>

<template>
  <InBasicTextInput
    v-model="username"
    :states="usernameState"
    :state-message="usernameMessage"
  />
</template>
implementationPatterns.when: Use for inputs that require async validation (username availability, email verification)
cons: Requires debouncing to avoid excessive API calls

implementationPatterns.name: Character-Limited Input
implementationPatterns.description: Text input with character counter for length constraints
implementationPatterns.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';

const bio = ref('');
const maxLength = 280;

const bioState = computed(() => {
  if (bio.value.length > maxLength) return 'error';
  if (bio.value.length > maxLength * 0.9) return 'warning';
  return 'default';
});

const bioMessage = computed(() => {
  if (bio.value.length > maxLength) {
    return `Bio exceeds maximum length by ${bio.value.length - maxLength} characters`;
  }
  return '';
});
</script>

<template>
  <InBasicTextInput
    v-model="bio"
    label-text="Bio"
    :max-character-length="maxLength"
    :character-counter-status="true"
    :states="bioState"
    :state-message="bioMessage"
    placeholder="Tell us about yourself..."
  />
</template>
implementationPatterns.when: Use for tweets, SMS messages, bios, or any length-constrained text
cons: May feel restrictive for some use cases

implementationPatterns.name: Multi-Unit Input
implementationPatterns.description: Numeric input with switchable unit suffix
implementationPatterns.code:
<script setup>
import { ref } from 'vue';

const distance = ref('');
const unit = ref('km');

const unitOptions = [
  { label: 'Kilometers', value: 'km' },
  { label: 'Miles', value: 'mi' },
  { label: 'Meters', value: 'm' }
];

const handleSuffixClick = (selectedUnit) => {
  unit.value = selectedUnit;
};
</script>

<template>
  <InBasicTextInput
    v-model="distance"
    type="number"
    label-text="Distance"
    :suffix-status="true"
    :suffix-text="unit"
    :actionable-suffix-status="true"
    :suffix-dropdown-options="unitOptions"
    @suffixClick="handleSuffixClick"
  />
</template>
implementationPatterns.when: Use for measurements, currencies, or any value with multiple unit options

InButtonV2.name: InButtonV2
InButtonV2.title: In Button

metadata.description: A versatile button component with multiple variants and states. Supports solid, ghost, and text styling with various color themes.

accessibility.notes: Supports aria-label, proper button semantics, keyboard focus management

performance.notes: Lazy loads icon components, minimal re-renders

examples.title: Loading State
examples.description: Show async operations in progress with spinner
examples.code:
<template>
  <InButtonV2
    id="save-btn"
    type="primary"
    label-text="Save"
    :loading-status="isLoading"
    @click="handleSave"
  />
</template>

<script setup>
import { ref } from 'vue';

const isLoading = ref(false);

const handleSave = async () => {
  isLoading.value = true;
  try {
    await api.save();
  } finally {
    isLoading.value = false;
  }
};
</script>

examples.description: Group related buttons together
examples.code:
<template>
  <InButtonV2
    id="period-selector"
    :button-group-options="periodOptions"
    @click="handlePeriodChange"
  />
</template>

<script setup>
import { ref } from 'vue';

const periodOptions = [
  { id: 'daily', type: 'secondary', styling: 'solid', labelText: 'Daily', selectedStatus: true },
  { id: 'weekly', type: 'secondary', styling: 'ghost', labelText: 'Weekly' },
  { id: 'monthly', type: 'secondary', styling: 'ghost', labelText: 'Monthly' }
];

const handlePeriodChange = (payload) => {
  console.log('Selected period:', payload.id);
};
</script>

commonMistakes.title: Using buttonGroupOptions with single button props
commonMistakes.description: When buttonGroupOptions is provided, single button props (labelText, leftIcon, type, styling) are ignored
commonMistakes.impact: Single button props don't work, causing confusion

commonMistakes.title: Passing number for iconSize instead of string
commonMistakes.description: iconSize prop expects STRING not NUMBER
commonMistakes.impact: Type validator fails, icon size defaults to '24'

commonMistakes.title: Not resetting loadingStatus in error handlers
commonMistakes.description: If async operation fails, loadingStatus stays true forever
commonMistakes.impact: Button stuck in loading state, user can't interact

commonMistakes.title: Expecting payload.value in button group click handler
commonMistakes.description: Button group click payload doesn't have 'value' property
commonMistakes.impact: Cannot access clicked button data

commonMistakes.title: Using camelCase for type prop value
commonMistakes.description: Type values use kebab-case, not camelCase
commonMistakes.impact: Validator fails, button shows as 'primary' type

commonMistakes.title: Icon-only button without accessible label
commonMistakes.description: Setting labelTextStatus=false without alternative text
commonMistakes.impact: Screen readers can't identify button purpose

commonMistakes.title: Creating buttonGroupOptions inline
commonMistakes.description: Inline array creation causes unnecessary re-renders
commonMistakes.impact: Component re-renders on every parent update

valueFormat.notes: Button visual style variant. Use enum constants STYLES.* from component

commonMistakes.mistake: Using string literal 'SOLID' instead of constant value 'solid'
commonMistakes.impact: Validator fails, falls back to default
commonMistakes.fix: Use STYLES.SOLID or literal 'solid'

valueFormat.enumReference: TYPES.PRIMARY | TYPES.SUBTLE_PRIMARY | TYPES.SECONDARY | TYPES.DANGER | TYPES.WARNING | TYPES.SMART | TYPES.SUBTLE_SMART | TYPES.INVERSE
valueFormat.notes: Button color theme. Determines background/text colors based on styling

commonMistakes.mistake: Using camelCase 'subtlePrimary' instead of kebab-case 'subtle-primary'
commonMistakes.impact: Validator fails, button shows as primary
commonMistakes.fix: Use TYPES.SUBTLE_PRIMARY or 'subtle-primary'

valueFormat.notes: Button size variant
CRITICAL: iconSize is STRING not number. '24' not 24

commonMistakes.mistake: Passing number instead of string: :icon-size="24"
commonMistakes.impact: Type mismatch, validator fails
commonMistakes.fix: Use string: icon-size="24" or :icon-size="'24'"

valueFormat.notes: Button text content. Shown when labelTextStatus=true

commonMistakes.mistake: Not providing labelText when labelTextStatus=true
commonMistakes.impact: Shows default 'Label' text
commonMistakes.fix: Always set labelText when using the button

valueFormat.objectShape: { id: string, type: string, styling: string, labelText: string, selectedStatus?: boolean, tooltipText?: string }
valueFormat.notes: Creates button group (multiple buttons in a row) when provided. Each button can have its own styling and type.
valueFormat.typescript: Array<{ id: string; type: string; styling: string; labelText: string; selectedStatus?: boolean; tooltipText?: string }>
valueFormat.realWorldExample: [{ id: 'daily', type: 'secondary', styling: 'solid', labelText: 'Daily', selectedStatus: true }, { id: 'weekly', type: 'secondary', styling: 'ghost', labelText: 'Weekly', selectedStatus: false }]

commonMistakes.mistake: Expecting simple array of strings ['Option 1', 'Option 2']
commonMistakes.impact: Component won't render button group properly
commonMistakes.fix: Use array of ButtonGroupOption objects with required properties (id, type, styling, labelText)

commonMistakes.mistake: Missing 'id' property in button group options
commonMistakes.impact: Cannot track which button was clicked
commonMistakes.fix: Always provide unique 'id' for each button: { id: 'unique-id', ... }

commonMistakes.mistake: Mixing button group with single button props (leftIcon, labelText)
commonMistakes.impact: Single button props are ignored when buttonGroupOptions is provided
commonMistakes.fix: Either use buttonGroupOptions OR single button props, not both

valueFormat.notes: Icon name from InIcons component set. See InIcons documentation for available icons.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using icon names that don't exist in InIcons
commonMistakes.impact: Icon won't display, may show broken icon or nothing
commonMistakes.fix: Check InIcons component for valid icon names

valueFormat.notes: Icon name from InIcons component set. Commonly used for dropdowns or external links.
ADVANCED: When true, clicking the icon emits 'clickIcon' event instead of 'click'. Used for buttons with separate icon and button actions.

commonMistakes.mistake: Setting iconClick=true but not listening to @clickIcon event
commonMistakes.impact: Icon clicks have no effect
commonMistakes.fix: Add @clickIcon handler: <InButtonV2 :icon-click="true" @clickIcon="handleIconClick" />

valueFormat.notes: Shows loading spinner and automatically disables button. Use during async operations.

commonMistakes.mistake: Not resetting loadingStatus after operation completes (especially on error)
commonMistakes.impact: Button stays in loading state permanently
commonMistakes.fix: Always set loadingStatus=false in finally block or error handler

commonMistakes.mistake: Using both loadingStatus and disabledStatus together
commonMistakes.impact: Redundant - loadingStatus already disables the button
commonMistakes.fix: Use only loadingStatus during async operations

valueFormat.notes: Shows success checkmark icon. Typically displayed briefly (2-3 seconds) after successful operation.

commonMistakes.mistake: Showing success state indefinitely
commonMistakes.impact: User confusion - button appears successful forever
commonMistakes.fix: Use setTimeout to reset after 2-3 seconds: setTimeout(() => this.successStatus = false, 2000)

valueFormat.objectShape: { id: string, dynamicPosition: boolean, staticPosition: string, iconStatus: boolean, offset: { x: number, y: number }, preventXss: boolean }
valueFormat.default: { id: 'tooltip', dynamicPosition: false, staticPosition: 'top center', iconStatus: false, offset: { x: 4, y: 4 }, preventXss: false }
valueFormat.notes: Configuration for button tooltip
valueFormat.typescript: { id: string; dynamicPosition: boolean; staticPosition: string; iconStatus: boolean; offset: { x: number; y: number }; preventXss: boolean }

valueFormat.notes: Skeleton loader dimensions in pixels

payloadFormat.notes: Empty {} for single button, ButtonGroupOption object for button groups

commonMistakes.mistake: Expecting payload.value in button group mode
commonMistakes.impact: Cannot access clicked button data
commonMistakes.fix: Use payload.id and payload.labelText - there's no payload.value

payloadFormat.notes: Emitted when icon is clicked (only when iconClick=true)

commonMistakes.mistake: Forgetting to set iconClick=true
commonMistakes.impact: Icon clicks trigger regular @click event instead of @clickIcon
commonMistakes.fix: Add :icon-click="true" prop when using @clickIcon

bestPractices.practice: Use constants for type and styling
bestPractices.why: Provides autocomplete, prevents typos, and type safety
Ensures loadingStatus is reset even if operation fails
bestPractices.example: try { await api.save(); } finally { isLoading.value = false; }
bestPractices.antiPattern: await api.save(); isLoading.value = false; // Never reached on error

bestPractices.why: Improves usability and accessibility

bestPractices.practice: Match button type to action semantics
bestPractices.why: Visual cues help users understand action importance
bestPractices.example: type="danger" for destructive actions, type="primary" for main CTA

bestPractices.why: Provides confirmation without permanent state change

bestPractices.practice: Always provide tooltip-text for icon-only buttons
bestPractices.why: Screen readers and users benefit from descriptive tooltips
bestPractices.antiPattern: Icon-only button without tooltip or aria-label

bestPractices.why: Prevents accidental data loss

performanceNotes.recommendation: Move buttonGroupOptions to data() or computed to avoid recreating array on every render
No special performance considerations needed. Safe to use many instances.

accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Screen readers need descriptive button text. Avoid generic labels like 'OK' or 'Submit'.

accessibilityNotes.note: Use disabledStatus instead of removing button
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Disabled state maintains button in tab order with aria-disabled for better keyboard navigation.
Provide tooltip-text for screen readers when labelTextStatus=false.

examples.title: Sales Trend Analysis
examples.description: Line chart showing monthly sales with target annotation
examples.code:
<script setup>
import { ref } from 'vue';
import { InChart } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const labels = ref(['Jan', 'Feb', 'Mar', 'Apr', 'May', 'Jun']);
const salesData = ref([[120, 150, 140, 180, 200, 190]]);

const targetLine = ref([{
  type: 'line',
  value: 150,
  borderColor: 'red',
  label: { content: 'Target', enabled: true }
}]);
</script>

<template>
  <InChart
    type="line"
    :labels="labels"
    :data="salesData"
    :chart-annotations="targetLine"
    :width="800"
    :height="400"
    theme="blue"
  />
</template>

commonMistakes.mistake: Not matching data and labels array lengths
commonMistakes.why: Chart.js requires equal length arrays for proper rendering
commonMistakes.impact: Chart renders incorrectly with missing or extra data points
commonMistakes.fix: Always ensure data[0].length === labels.length for each dataset

commonMistakes.mistake: Using single array instead of nested array for data
commonMistakes.why: Component expects data as array of arrays even for single dataset
commonMistakes.impact: Chart fails to render or shows errors
commonMistakes.fix: Wrap single dataset in outer array: [[values]] instead of [values]

commonMistakes.mistake: Forgetting to set width/height for responsive charts
commonMistakes.why: Chart may not render properly without dimensions
commonMistakes.impact: Chart appears too small or doesn't resize correctly
commonMistakes.fix: Set width and height props, or set both to 0 for full container size

commonMistakes.mistake: Not providing color palette for multi-dataset charts
commonMistakes.why: Default colors may not be distinguishable or match design
commonMistakes.impact: Poor visual distinction between datasets
commonMistakes.fix: Always provide colorPalette or datasetSettings with custom colors
commonMistakes.example:
:color-palette="['#FF6384', '#36A2EB', '#FFCE56']"
// or use datasetSettings for more control

type.description: Chart type (line, bar, pie, doughnut, etc.)

valueFormat.notes: REQUIRED. Determines the visualization type using Chart.js types. Common values: 'line' for time series, 'bar' for comparisons, 'pie'/'doughnut' for proportions, 'radar' for multi-dimensional data. Each type has different data structure requirements.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using wrong data structure for chart type
commonMistakes.impact: Chart fails to render or shows incorrect visualization
commonMistakes.fix: Line/bar charts need {x, y} or array values, pie charts need single array

valueFormat.notes: REQUIRED. Labels for X-axis (line/bar charts) or category names (pie charts). For time series, use date strings or Date objects. Length must match data array length. Labels are automatically truncated based on labelLimit prop.

valueFormat.structure: Array of numbers or array of arrays
valueFormat.notes: REQUIRED. Data points for visualization. Single array for single dataset, array of arrays for multiple datasets. For line/bar charts: numbers or {x, y} objects. For pie/doughnut: array of numbers. Must match labels length.
valueFormat.typescript: Array<number> | Array<Array<number>> | Array<{x: any, y: number}>

commonMistakes.mistake: Data and labels length mismatch
commonMistakes.impact: Chart renders incorrectly or shows warnings
commonMistakes.fix: Ensure data array length matches labels array length

valueFormat.notes: Predefined color scheme for chart. 'blue' (default) uses blue tones, other themes provide different color palettes. Overridden by colorPalette if provided.
Custom colors for chart elements. Hex codes, RGB, or named colors. For multi-dataset charts, one color per dataset. For pie/doughnut, one color per slice. Overrides theme setting.

valueFormat.structure: Object with display, position, labels settings
valueFormat.notes: Controls legend appearance and behavior. Common options: {display: boolean, position: 'top'|'bottom'|'left'|'right', labels: {fontSize, fontColor}}. Use to customize or hide legend.
valueFormat.typescript: { display?: boolean; position?: string; labels?: object; }

valueFormat.notes: Extends default tooltip behavior. Options: enabled, backgroundColor, titleColor, bodyColor, callbacks for custom formatting. Use callbacks to format displayed values (e.g., add currency symbols).
Adds reference lines, boxes, or points to chart. Each annotation has type ('line', 'box', 'point'), value (y-axis position), and styling. Useful for thresholds, targets, or highlighting regions.
valueFormat.typescript: Array<{ type: string; value: number; borderColor?: string; label?: object; }>

valueFormat.notes: Controls Y-axis tick intervals. {stepSize: number} sets the distance between ticks. Useful for ensuring consistent scales across charts or showing specific intervals.
Customizes each dataset independently. Options: label, borderColor, backgroundColor, borderWidth, fill, tension (for line smoothing). Array index matches data array index.
valueFormat.typescript: Array<{ label?: string; borderColor?: string; backgroundColor?: string; borderWidth?: number; fill?: boolean; tension?: number; }>

bestPractices.title: Always Provide Accessible Labels
bestPractices.description: Add aria-label to chart container for screen reader users
bestPractices.reasoning: Canvas-based charts are not accessible by default. Descriptive labels help screen reader users understand the data

bestPractices.title: Use Annotations for Important Thresholds
bestPractices.description: Highlight targets, limits, or significant values with annotation lines
bestPractices.reasoning: Annotations provide visual context and help users quickly identify important reference points

bestPractices.title: Aggregate Large Datasets
bestPractices.description: Group data into larger time periods for better performance and readability
bestPractices.reasoning: Charts with 100+ data points can be slow and hard to read. Aggregation improves both performance and clarity

bestPractices.title: Customize Tooltips for Better Context
bestPractices.description: Add custom formatting to tooltip values for clarity
bestPractices.reasoning: Default tooltips show raw numbers. Custom formatting adds units, currency symbols, or percentages for better understanding

performanceNotes.description: Rendering 1000+ data points can slow chart rendering
performanceNotes.recommendation: Aggregate data into larger time buckets (hourly → daily, daily → weekly). Use data decimation or sampling for very large datasets. Consider using chart plugins for better performance with large data

performanceNotes.description: Frequent data updates cause full chart re-renders
performanceNotes.recommendation: Use reactive refs but update chart data in batches. Debounce real-time updates. Consider using chart update methods instead of full re-renders

performanceNotes.description: Rendering many charts simultaneously impacts performance
performanceNotes.recommendation: Use lazy loading or virtual scrolling for dashboard pages with many charts. Render charts only when visible (intersection observer)

accessibilityNotes.description: Canvas-based charts are not inherently accessible to screen readers
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Always provide text alternatives. Use aria-label on chart container describing the data. Consider providing data table alternative for complex charts

accessibilityNotes.description: Chart colors must have sufficient contrast for visibility
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Use colorPalette with high-contrast colors. Avoid relying solely on color to convey information. Use patterns or textures in addition to colors

accessibilityNotes.description: Complex charts should have tabular data alternative
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Provide a 'View as Table' option that displays the same data in an accessible HTML table format

accessibilityNotes.description: Chart interactions should be keyboard accessible
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: If chart has interactive elements (click handlers), ensure they're keyboard accessible. Provide keyboard shortcuts for common actions
accessibilityNotes.example: // Use native Chart.js keyboard plugin or implement custom keyboard handlers

chartWithAnnotations.title: Chart with Target Line
chartWithAnnotations.description: Line chart with annotation showing target threshold
chartWithAnnotations.code:
<script setup>
import { ref } from 'vue';
import { InChart } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const labels = ref(['Week 1', 'Week 2', 'Week 3', 'Week 4']);
const data = ref([[85, 92, 78, 95]]);

const annotations = ref([
  {
    type: 'line',
    value: 90,
    borderColor: 'red',
    borderWidth: 2,
    borderDash: [5, 5],
    label: {
      content: 'Target: 90%',
      enabled: true,
      position: 'end'
    }
  }
]);

const tooltipsSettings = ref({
  callbacks: {
    label: (context) => `Performance: ${context.parsed.y}%`
  }
});
</script>

<template>
  <InChart
    type="line"
    :labels="labels"
    :data="data"
    :chart-annotations="annotations"
    :tooltips-extra-settings="tooltipsSettings"
    :step="{ stepSize: 10 }"
  />
</template>

cssVariables.--chart-font-family: Font family for labels and text (default: system font)

styling.notes: Chart uses Chart.js library internally. Most styling is done through props (theme, colorPalette, legendSettings, etc.) rather than CSS.

implementationPatterns.name: Multi-Metric Comparison
implementationPatterns.description: Compare multiple metrics with different scales using multiple Y-axes
implementationPatterns.code:
<script setup>
import { ref } from 'vue';
import { InChart } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const labels = ref(['Jan', 'Feb', 'Mar', 'Apr', 'May']);
const data = ref([
  [1200, 1900, 3000, 5000, 4000], // Revenue
  [50, 65, 80, 95, 85]             // Conversion Rate %
]);

const datasetSettings = ref([
  {
    label: 'Revenue ($)',
    yAxisID: 'y-axis-1',
    borderColor: '#36A2EB',
    backgroundColor: 'rgba(54, 162, 235, 0.2)'
  },
  {
    label: 'Conversion Rate (%)',
    yAxisID: 'y-axis-2',
    borderColor: '#FF6384',
    backgroundColor: 'rgba(255, 99, 132, 0.2)'
  }
]);

const labelYAxesTicksExtraSettings = ref({
  yAxes: [
    {
      id: 'y-axis-1',
      position: 'left',
      ticks: {
        callback: (value) => `$${value}`
      }
    },
    {
      id: 'y-axis-2',
      position: 'right',
      ticks: {
        callback: (value) => `${value}%`
      }
    }
  ]
});
</script>

<template>
  <InChart
    type="line"
    :labels="labels"
    :data="data"
    :dataset-settings="datasetSettings"
    :label-y-axes-ticks-extra-settings="labelYAxesTicksExtraSettings"
  />
</template>
implementationPatterns.when: Use when comparing metrics with different units or scales (e.g., revenue vs. percentage)
cons: Can be complex for users to understand

implementationPatterns.name: Interactive Pie Chart with Tooltips
implementationPatterns.description: Pie chart with custom tooltips and click handling
implementationPatterns.code:
<script setup>
import { ref } from 'vue';
import { InChart } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const labels = ref(['Direct', 'Organic', 'Paid', 'Social', 'Referral']);
const data = ref([[35, 25, 20, 12, 8]]);

const colorPalette = ref([
  '#FF6384',
  '#36A2EB',
  '#FFCE56',
  '#4BC0C0',
  '#9966FF'
]);

const tooltipsSettings = ref({
  callbacks: {
    label: (context) => {
      const label = context.label || '';
      const value = context.parsed;
      const total = context.dataset.data.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0);
      const percentage = ((value / total) * 100).toFixed(1);
      return `${label}: ${value} (${percentage}%)`;
    }
  }
});

const dataText = ref([
  labels.value.map((_, i) => `${data.value[0][i]}%`)
]);
</script>

<template>
  <InChart
    type="pie"
    :labels="labels"
    :data="data"
    :data-text="dataText"
    :color-palette="colorPalette"
    :tooltips-extra-settings="tooltipsSettings"
    :legend-settings="{ position: 'right' }"
  />
</template>
implementationPatterns.when: Use for showing proportional data distribution with detailed breakdowns
cons: Limited to showing parts of a whole

InCheckBoxV2.name: InCheckBoxV2
InCheckBoxV2.title: In Check Box

metadata.description: Checkbox component with indeterminate state and size variants

InCheckBoxV2.typeDefs:
import { DefineComponent } from 'vue';

/**
 * Validation state variants for the checkbox.
 */
export type CheckboxState = 'default' | 'danger' | 'warning';

/**
 * Checkbox option for group mode.
 */
export interface CheckboxOption {
  /**
   * Display text for the checkbox option.
   */
  text: string;

  /**
   * Unique value for the checkbox option.
   */
  value: string | number;

  /**
   * Whether this option is checked by default.
   * @default false
   */
  checked?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Skeleton loader sizing configuration.
 */
export interface SkeletonSizing {
  /**
   * Skeleton width in pixels.
   */
  width: number;

  /**
   * Skeleton height in pixels.
   */
  height: number;
}

/**
 * InCheckBoxV2 component props.
 */
export interface InCheckBoxV2Props {
  /**
   * Unique identifier for the checkbox element.
   * Used for DOM manipulation, testing, and label association.
   *
   * @required
   * @example id="terms-checkbox"
   * @example id="subscribe-newsletter"
   */
  id: string;

  /**
   * Name attribute for the checkbox input.
   * Used in form submissions.
   *
   * @default ''
   * @example name="terms"
   * @example :name="123"
   */
  name?: string | number;

  /**
   * Label text displayed next to the checkbox.
   * Supports HTML content when preventXss is false.
   *
   * @default ''
   * @example label-text="I accept the terms and conditions"
   * @example label-text="Enable notifications"
   */
  labelText?: string;

  /**
   * Additional description text displayed below the label.
   * Provides more context about the checkbox option.
   *
   * @default ''
   * @example description-text="Receive updates about new features"
   */
  descriptionText?: string;

  /**
   * Validation or state message text.
   * Typically used for error or warning messages.
   *
   * @default ''
   * @example state-message="This field is required"
   * @example state-message="Please review the terms"
   */
  stateMessage?: string;

  /**
   * Enables tooltip display on the label.
   * Tooltip content comes from tooltipText prop.
   *
   * @default false
   * @example :tooltip-status="true"
   */
  tooltipStatus?: boolean;

  /**
   * Shows the description text below the label.
   * Must be true for descriptionText to be visible.
   *
   * @default false
   * @example :description-status="true"
   */
  descriptionStatus?: boolean;

  /**
   * Controls visibility of the label text.
   * When false, only the checkbox input is shown.
   *
   * @default true
   * @example :label-status="false"
   */
  labelStatus?: boolean;

  /**
   * Makes the label text bold.
   * Useful for emphasizing important checkboxes.
   *
   * @default false
   * @example :bold-label="true"
   */
  boldLabel?: boolean;

  /**
   * Tooltip content text.
   * Only shown when tooltipStatus is true.
   *
   * @default ''
   * @example tooltip-text="Additional information about this option"
   */
  tooltipText?: string;

  /**
   * Shows skeleton loading placeholder instead of checkbox.
   * Used during initial page load.
   *
   * @default false
   * @example :skeleton-status="isLoading"
   */
  skeletonStatus?: boolean;

  /**
   * Dimensions for the skeleton loader.
   * Only used when skeletonStatus is true.
   *
   * @default { width: 70, height: 24 }
   * @example :skeleton-sizing="{ width: 120, height: 32 }"
   */
  skeletonSizing?: SkeletonSizing;

  /**
   * Shows indeterminate state (dash icon).
   * Used for "select all" functionality when some items are selected.
   *
   * @default false
   * @example :indeterminate="someSelected && !allSelected"
   */
  indeterminate?: boolean;

  /**
   * Controls the checked state of the checkbox.
   * Use with v-model for two-way binding.
   *
   * @default false
   * @example :checked="isAccepted"
   * @example v-model="termsAccepted"
   */
  checked?: boolean;

  /**
   * Disables the checkbox, preventing user interaction.
   * Checkbox appears greyed out and cannot be toggled.
   *
   * @default false
   * @example :disabled-status="!canModify"
   */
  disabledStatus?: boolean;

  /**
   * Array of checkbox options for group mode.
   * When provided, renders multiple checkboxes in a group.
   *
   * @default []
   * @example
   * :options="[
   *   { text: 'Option 1', value: 'opt1', checked: true },
   *   { text: 'Option 2', value: 'opt2', checked: false }
   * ]"
   */
  options?: CheckboxOption[];

  /**
   * Validation state of the checkbox.
   * Affects border color and state message styling.
   *
   * @default 'default'
   * @example state="danger" // Red border for errors
   * @example state="warning" // Yellow border for warnings
   */
  state?: CheckboxState;
}

/**
 * Click event payload for single checkbox.
 */
export type SingleCheckboxClickPayload = boolean;

/**
 * Click event payload for checkbox group.
 */
export type CheckboxGroupClickPayload = Array<string | number>;

/**
 * Event handler types for InCheckBoxV2.
 */
export interface InCheckBoxV2EventHandlers {
  /**
   * Handler for click event.
   * For single checkbox, payload is boolean (checked state).
   * For checkbox groups, payload is array of selected values.
   *
   * @param payload - Boolean for single checkbox, array for checkbox group
   * @example
   * // Single checkbox
   * const handleClick = (checked: boolean) => {
   *   console.log('Checkbox is now:', checked);
   * }
   *
   * @example
   * // Checkbox group
   * const handleClick = (selected: Array<string | number>) => {
   *   console.log('Selected values:', selected);
   * }
   */
  onClick?: (payload: SingleCheckboxClickPayload | CheckboxGroupClickPayload) => void;
}

/**
 * InCheckBoxV2 Component
 *
 * Flexible checkbox component supporting single checkboxes, checkbox groups,
 * indeterminate state, validation states, and skeleton loading.
 *
 * @example
 * // Basic single checkbox
 * <InCheckBoxV2
 *   id="terms"
 *   name="terms"
 *   label-text="I accept the terms"
 *   :checked="accepted"
 *   @click="accepted = $event"
 * />
 *
 * @example
 * // With description
 * <InCheckBoxV2
 *   id="notifications"
 *   label-text="Enable notifications"
 *   description-text="Get email updates"
 *   :description-status="true"
 *   :checked="notificationsEnabled"
 *   @click="notificationsEnabled = $event"
 * />
 *
 * @example
 * // Indeterminate state
 * <InCheckBoxV2
 *   id="select-all"
 *   label-text="Select all"
 *   :checked="allSelected"
 *   :indeterminate="someSelected"
 *   @click="toggleAll"
 * />
 *
 * @example
 * // Checkbox group
 * <InCheckBoxV2
 *   id="interests"
 *   label-text="Select your interests"
 *   :options="[
 *     { text: 'Technology', value: 'tech', checked: true },
 *     { text: 'Design', value: 'design', checked: false }
 *   ]"
 *   @click="handleGroupSelection"
 * />
 *
 * @example
 * // With validation
 * <InCheckBoxV2
 *   id="required"
 *   label-text="Required field"
 *   state="danger"
 *   state-message="You must accept this"
 *   :checked="value"
 *   @click="value = $event"
 * />
 */
declare const InCheckBoxV2: DefineComponent<InCheckBoxV2Props>;

export default InCheckBoxV2;

examples.title: Form Validation with Error State
examples.description: Required checkbox with validation and error message
examples.code:
<template>
  <form @submit.prevent="handleSubmit">
    <InCheckBoxV2
      id="terms"
      name="terms"
      label-text="I accept the terms and conditions"
      :checked="formData.termsAccepted"
      :state="errors.terms ? 'danger' : 'default'"
      :state-message="errors.terms"
      @click="formData.termsAccepted = $event; validateTerms();"
    />
    
    <button type="submit" :disabled="!formData.termsAccepted">
      Continue
    </button>
  </form>
</template>

<script setup>
import { reactive, ref } from 'vue';

const formData = reactive({
  termsAccepted: false
});

const errors = ref({});

const validateTerms = () => {
  if (!formData.termsAccepted) {
    errors.value.terms = 'You must accept the terms to continue';
  } else {
    delete errors.value.terms;
  }
};

const handleSubmit = () => {
  validateTerms();
  if (Object.keys(errors.value).length === 0) {
    console.log('Form submitted!');
  }
};
</script>

commonMistakes.title: Using simple string array for options
commonMistakes.description: options prop requires array of objects, not strings
commonMistakes.correct: :options="[{ id: 'opt1', label: 'Option 1', value: 'value1' }, { id: 'opt2', label: 'Option 2', value: 'value2' }]"
commonMistakes.impact: Checkbox group won't render, component may throw errors

commonMistakes.title: Not handling click event
commonMistakes.description: Checkbox state must be tracked with @click handler
commonMistakes.impact: Checkbox state not tracked, selections lost

commonMistakes.title: Mixing single checkbox with options array
commonMistakes.description: Either use single checkbox mode OR checkbox group mode, not both
commonMistakes.impact: Unpredictable behavior, single checkbox props ignored when options provided

commonMistakes.title: Not providing accessible labels
commonMistakes.description: Each checkbox should have clear, descriptive label
commonMistakes.correct: label-text="I agree to the Terms and Conditions"
commonMistakes.impact: Poor accessibility for screen readers, unclear purpose

commonMistakes.title: Using @change instead of @click
commonMistakes.description: InCheckBoxV2 uses click event, not change
commonMistakes.impact: Event handler may not fire as expected

commonMistakes.title: Setting indeterminate without proper logic
commonMistakes.description: Indeterminate state should only show for partial selection
commonMistakes.impact: Confusing UX, indeterminate shown when it shouldn't be

valueFormat.objectShape: Array<{ id: string, label: string, value: any, disabled?: boolean, checked?: boolean }>
valueFormat.notes: When provided, renders multiple checkboxes in a group. Each option must have id and label. Useful for checkbox groups with multiple selections.

examples.value: [{ id: 'opt1', label: 'Option 1', value: 'value1' }, { id: 'opt2', label: 'Option 2', value: 'value2' }]

valueFormat.typescript: Array<{ id: string; label: string; value: any; disabled?: boolean; checked?: boolean }>

commonMistakes.mistake: Using simple array of strings ['Option 1', 'Option 2']
commonMistakes.impact: Component won't render checkbox group properly
commonMistakes.fix: Use array of objects with id, label, and value properties

commonMistakes.mistake: Missing 'id' property in options
commonMistakes.impact: Cannot track which checkbox was selected, events don't work properly
commonMistakes.fix: Always provide unique 'id' for each option: { id: 'unique-id', label: '...', value: '...' }

commonMistakes.mistake: Using same id for multiple options
commonMistakes.impact: Checkbox state conflicts, unpredictable behavior
commonMistakes.fix: Ensure each option has a unique id within the group

commonMistakes.mistake: Not handling click event with checkbox group
commonMistakes.impact: Selected values not tracked, state not updated
commonMistakes.fix: Use @click handler or v-model to track selected values: @click="handleClick"

valueFormat.notes: Defines dimensions for skeleton loader placeholder. Only used when skeletonStatus is true.

examples.code: :skeleton-sizing="{ width: 20, height: 20 }"
:skeleton-sizing="{ width: 24, height: 24 }"

commonMistakes.mistake: Setting skeletonSizing without skeletonStatus
commonMistakes.impact: skeletonSizing has no effect if skeletonStatus is false
commonMistakes.fix: Enable skeleton: :skeleton-status="true" :skeleton-sizing="{ width: 20, height: 20 }"

valueFormat.notes: Shows dash/minus icon instead of checkmark. Used for "select all" pattern when some (but not all) items are selected.

commonMistakes.mistake: Setting both indeterminate=true and checked=true
commonMistakes.impact: Indeterminate state takes precedence, checked is ignored
commonMistakes.fix: Use indeterminate for partial selection only: :indeterminate="someSelected && !allSelected"

commonMistakes.mistake: Not using computed property for indeterminate state
commonMistakes.impact: Manual state management is error-prone
commonMistakes.fix: Use computed: const indeterminate = computed(() => selected.length > 0 && selected.length < total)

valueFormat.notes: Validation state that affects border and message styling

commonMistakes.mistake: Using 'error' instead of 'danger'
commonMistakes.impact: Falls back to default state
commonMistakes.fix: Use state="danger" for error states

payloadFormat.notes: For single checkbox: boolean (checked state). For checkbox groups: array of selected values.

click.usagePattern: Use with @click to handle checkbox changes. For single checkbox, receive boolean. For groups, receive array of selected values.

commonMistakes.mistake: Expecting single value from checkbox group
commonMistakes.impact: Type mismatch, handler receives array not string
commonMistakes.fix: For groups, handle array: @click="(selected) => selectedValues = selected"

commonMistakes.mistake: Not handling click event at all
commonMistakes.impact: Checkbox state not tracked, selections lost
commonMistakes.fix: Always handle @click or use v-model: @click="handleClick" or v-model="checked"

commonMistakes.mistake: Using @change instead of @click
commonMistakes.impact: Event may not fire as expected, InCheckBoxV2 uses click event
commonMistakes.fix: Use @click for InCheckBoxV2 (not @change)

bestPractices.practice: Always provide unique IDs for each checkbox
bestPractices.why: Ensures proper label association and form submission
Improves accessibility and user understanding
bestPractices.example: label-text="I want to receive marketing emails"

bestPractices.practice: Handle the click event for state management
bestPractices.why: Enables reactive state updates and validation
bestPractices.antiPattern: <!-- No event handler, state not tracked -->

bestPractices.practice: Use state and stateMessage props for validation
bestPractices.why: Provides immediate visual feedback for errors
bestPractices.antiPattern: <!-- Error shown elsewhere, not connected to checkbox -->

bestPractices.practice: Use indeterminate state for "select all" checkboxes
bestPractices.why: Shows partial selection state clearly
bestPractices.antiPattern: <!-- No visual indication of partial selection -->

bestPractices.practice: Provide description text for complex options
bestPractices.why: Helps users understand what they're agreeing to
bestPractices.example:
description-text="We'll send you weekly product updates"
:description-status="true"

bestPractices.practice: Use computed properties for dynamic states
bestPractices.why: Reduces manual state synchronization and errors
bestPractices.antiPattern: // Manually updating allSelected on every change

performanceNotes: Large checkbox groups (50+ options) may impact render performance - consider virtualization
Re-creating options array on every render causes unnecessary re-renders - use computed or ref
Checkbox group with many options should use key prop for efficient updates
For very large lists, consider lazy loading or pagination instead of rendering all checkboxes
accessibilityNotes: Each checkbox automatically gets proper ARIA attributes
Ensure labels are descriptive and clear for screen readers
Required checkboxes should be marked visually (e.g., with asterisk) and programmatically
Group related checkboxes with role="group" and aria-labelledby for better context
Support keyboard navigation (Tab, Space, Arrow keys for groups)
Ensure sufficient color contrast for all states (checked, unchecked, disabled, error)
Announce state changes to screen readers (especially for indeterminate state)
Use :bold-label="true" for visually emphasizing required or important checkboxes

implementationPatterns.when: Integrating checkbox in forms with validation
implementationPatterns.code:
<template>
  <form @submit.prevent="handleSubmit">
    <InCheckBoxV2
      id="terms"
      name="terms"
      label-text="I accept the terms"
      :checked="formData.terms"
      :state="errors.terms ? 'danger' : 'default'"
      :state-message="errors.terms"
      @click="updateField('terms', $event)"
    />
    
    <button type="submit">Submit</button>
  </form>
</template>

<script setup>
import { reactive, ref } from 'vue';

const formData = reactive({ terms: false });
const errors = ref({});

const updateField = (field, value) => {
  formData[field] = value;
  validateField(field);
};

const validateField = (field) => {
  if (field === 'terms' && !formData.terms) {
    errors.value.terms = 'Required field';
  } else {
    delete errors.value.terms;
  }
};

const handleSubmit = () => {
  Object.keys(formData).forEach(validateField);
  if (Object.keys(errors.value).length === 0) {
    // Submit form
  }
};
</script>
implementationPatterns.notes: Always validate on change for immediate feedback. Use state prop for visual error indication.

implementationPatterns.when: Implementing bulk selection with master checkbox
implementationPatterns.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';

const items = ref([1, 2, 3, 4, 5]);
const selectedItems = ref([]);

const allSelected = computed(() => 
  selectedItems.value.length === items.value.length && items.value.length > 0
);

const someSelected = computed(() => 
  selectedItems.value.length > 0 && !allSelected.value
);

const toggleAll = (checked) => {
  selectedItems.value = checked ? [...items.value] : [];
};

const toggleItem = (item, checked) => {
  if (checked) {
    selectedItems.value.push(item);
  } else {
    selectedItems.value = selectedItems.value.filter(i => i !== item);
  }
};
</script>

<template>
  <InCheckBoxV2
    id="select-all"
    label-text="Select all"
    :checked="allSelected"
    :indeterminate="someSelected"
    @click="toggleAll"
  />
  
  <InCheckBoxV2
    v-for="item in items"
    :key="item"
    :id="`item-${item}`"
    :label-text="`Item ${item}`"
    :checked="selectedItems.includes(item)"
    @click="(checked) => toggleItem(item, checked)"
  />
</template>
implementationPatterns.notes: Use computed properties for allSelected and someSelected states. Indeterminate only shows when some (but not all) items are selected.

implementationPatterns.when: Rendering checkboxes from API data or dynamic lists
implementationPatterns.notes: Show skeleton loader while fetching options. Handle disabled state based on API data. Sync selections with backend.

implementationPatterns.when: Ensuring checkboxes are keyboard accessible
implementationPatterns.notes: Use role="group" and aria-labelledby for checkbox groups. Support arrow key navigation. Ensure focus management.

commonMistakes.fix: Use number without unit: :max-width="150" (not "150px")

valueFormat.notes: Makes the chip label clickable. When true, clicking label emits tagClick event (separate from close button click)

commonMistakes.mistake: Setting actionableLabel=true but not handling @tagClick
commonMistakes.impact: Cursor changes to pointer but nothing happens on click
commonMistakes.fix: Add @tagClick handler: @tagClick="handleLabelClick"

commonMistakes.mistake: Confusing with @click event
commonMistakes.impact: Wrong handler called (click is for close button, tagClick is for label)
commonMistakes.fix: Use @tagClick for label clicks, @click for close button

valueFormat.notes: Enables hover and active states. When false, chip has no hover effects

commonMistakes.mistake: Setting interactive=false with actionableLabel=true
commonMistakes.impact: Conflicting states, label won't be clickable
commonMistakes.fix: Set interactive=true when using actionableLabel

valueFormat.notes: Shows chip as selected/active with highlighted styling

commonMistakes.mistake: Using selectedStatus without state management
commonMistakes.impact: Selection state not tracked, chips don't stay selected
commonMistakes.fix: Bind to reactive state: :selected-status="selectedChips.includes(chip.value)"

payloadFormat.notes: Emitted when close button (X) is clicked. Payload is the chip's value prop

click.when: User clicks the close/remove button on the chip
click.usagePattern: Use @click to handle chip removal from list

commonMistakes.mistake: Confusing @click with @tagClick
commonMistakes.impact: Handler called for wrong interaction (click is close button, tagClick is label)
commonMistakes.fix: @click for removal, @tagClick for label interaction

commonMistakes.mistake: Not removing chip from list on @click
commonMistakes.impact: Chip visually remains after clicking close button
commonMistakes.fix: Filter chip from list: chips = chips.filter(c => c.value !== value)

payloadFormat.notes: Emitted when chip label is clicked (only when actionableLabel=true). Payload is the chip's value prop

tagClick.when: User clicks the chip label/text (not the close button)
tagClick.usagePattern: Use @tagClick for navigation or showing chip details. Requires actionableLabel=true

commonMistakes.mistake: Expecting tagClick without setting actionableLabel=true
commonMistakes.impact: Event never fires, clicking label does nothing
commonMistakes.fix: Set :actionable-label="true" to enable label clicks

commonMistakes.mistake: Using @tag-click instead of @tagClick (camelCase)
commonMistakes.impact: Event handler not attached
commonMistakes.fix: Use camelCase in template: @tagClick (or kebab @tag-click if preferred)

bestPractices.why: Enables proper tracking and removal of specific chips
Provides visual cues about chip purpose/status
bestPractices.example: type="danger" for errors, type="smart" for success, type="warning" for alerts

bestPractices.why: Prevents layout breaks with long chip labels
bestPractices.antiPattern: Allowing unlimited width, breaking responsive layouts

bestPractices.why: Separates navigation from removal interactions
bestPractices.antiPattern: Using @click for both navigation and removal

bestPractices.why: Makes it clear chips cannot be removed
bestPractices.antiPattern: Showing close button on non-removable chips

bestPractices.why: Shows active/selected state visually
bestPractices.antiPattern: No visual indication of selected filters

bestPractices.practice: Wrap chips in flex container with gap
bestPractices.why: Provides consistent spacing and wrapping

performanceNotes: Large chip lists (100+ chips) should use virtual scrolling
Re-creating chip array on every render causes unnecessary re-renders - use stable references
For chip lists, use computed properties to derive display state
Avoid inline event handlers - define methods in setup() for better performance
accessibilityNotes: Each chip has proper ARIA attributes for assistive technologies
Close button has aria-label for screen readers
Use descriptive text labels, not generic 'Tag 1', 'Tag 2'
Selected chips should have aria-pressed or aria-selected state
Ensure sufficient color contrast for all chip types
Support keyboard navigation (Tab to focus, Enter/Space to activate, Delete to remove)
Announce chip removal to screen readers
Group related chips with aria-labelledby for context

template.truncated:
<InChips
  text="This is a very long chip text that will be truncated"
  value="long-1"
  :max-width="150"
  @click="handleRemove"
/>

<InChips text="Magenta" value="8" type="magenta" />

customization.notes: Chips use type and style-based CSS classes. Override .in-chips--{type} classes to customize colors

responsive.notes: Chips scale appropriately on all devices. Consider using max-width on mobile for long text

styling.layoutNotes: Chips are inline-flex by default. Wrap in flex container with gap for spacing. Use flex-wrap: wrap for multi-line chip lists.

implementationPatterns.when: Managing a list of removable tags/filters
implementationPatterns.notes: Use unique IDs for value prop. Filter array on removal. Optionally sync with backend.

implementationPatterns.when: Creating filter UI with toggleable chips
implementationPatterns.notes: Use selectedStatus for visual feedback. Toggle selection in array. closeButton=false for filter chips.

implementationPatterns.when: Chips represent items with detail pages
implementationPatterns.notes: Use actionableLabel=true. @tagClick for navigation, @click for removal. Separate concerns.

implementationPatterns.when: Displaying status with color-coded chips
implementationPatterns.notes: Use computed for dynamic type/label. closeButton=false and interactive=false for read-only badges.
