InDatePickerV2.name: InDatePickerV2
InDatePickerV2.title: In Date Picker

metadata.description: Advanced date picker with single date, date range, and comparison modes. Features quick range selection, custom ranges, date constraints, and multi-locale support.

accessibility.notes: Supports keyboard navigation (Tab, Enter, Arrow keys), proper label association, state announcements, and focus management. Calendar navigation is fully keyboard accessible.

performance.notes: Complex calendar rendering with dual calendars in comparison mode. Uses masked input for date entry. Optimized with v-show for calendar visibility. Consider lazy loading for applications not requiring date selection on initial load.

modes.dateRange: Select a start and end date range
modes.comparison: Select two date ranges for comparison (e.g., current period vs previous period)

features.quickRanges: Pre-defined quick selection buttons (Today, Yesterday, Last Week, etc.)
features.customRanges: Add custom date ranges to quick selection
features.dateConstraints: Min/max date restrictions with disabled date ranges
features.comparison: Compare two date periods with automatic previous period calculation
features.localization: Support for multiple date formats (US, UK, Turkish, etc.)
features.timezone: Timezone offset support for international applications
features.validation: Real-time date validation with custom error messages
features.specialDates: Highlight specific dates with custom colors and labels

useCases: Analytics dashboards with date range selection

examples.title: Basic Date Range Picker
examples.description: Simple date range picker without comparison
examples.code:
<template>
  <InDatePickerV2
    id="date-picker"
    name="date-picker"
    theme="white"
    label-text="Select Period"
    :value="dateValue"
    :min-date="minDate"
    :max-date="maxDate"
    :locale="locale"
    :format-mapping="formatMapping"
    :quick-range-selection-status="true"
    @apply="handleApply" />
</template>

<script>
import { InDatePickerV2 } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InDatePickerV2 },
  
  data() {
    return {
      startDate: '01.12.2024',
      endDate: '20.12.2024',
      minDate: '01.01.2023',
      maxDate: new Date(),
      locale: 'tr-TR',
      formatMapping: {
        'tr-TR': 'dd.mm.yyyy',
        'en-US': 'mm/dd/yyyy',
        'default': 'dd.mm.yyyy'
      }
    };
  },
  
  computed: {
    dateValue() {
      return [{
        startDate: this.startDate,
        endDate: this.endDate
      }];
    }
  },
  
  methods: {
    handleApply(payload) {
      // payload is string: "mm/dd/yyyy-mm/dd/yyyy"
      const [start, end] = payload.split('-');
      this.startDate = this.convertToLocalFormat(start);
      this.endDate = this.convertToLocalFormat(end);
    },
    
    convertToLocalFormat(dateStr) {
      // Convert mm/dd/yyyy to dd.mm.yyyy for Turkish locale
      const [month, day, year] = dateStr.split('/');
      return `${day}.${month}.${year}`;
    }
  }
};
</script>

examples.title: With Comparison & Dynamic Ranges
examples.description: Full-featured date picker with comparison mode and dynamically calculated comparison ranges
examples.code:
<template>
  <InDatePickerV2
    :key="`${datePickerKey}-${startDate}-${endDate}`"
    id="date-picker-compare"
    name="date-picker-compare"
    theme="white"
    label-text="Select Period"
    :value="datePickerValue"
    :min-date="minDate"
    :max-date="maxDate"
    :locale="locale"
    :format-mapping="formatMapping"
    :comparison-status="true"
    :disabled-comparison-status="compareDisabled"
    :quick-range-selection-status="true"
    :custom-ranges="customRangesForV2"
    :compared-custom-ranges="comparedCustomRangesForV2"
    @apply="handleApply"
    @periodSelected="handlePeriodSelected"
    @openComparison="handleOpenComparison"
    @closeComparison="handleCloseComparison" />
</template>

<script>
import { InDatePickerV2 } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InDatePickerV2 },
  
  data() {
    return {
      datePickerKey: 0,
      startDate: '01.12.2024',
      endDate: '20.12.2024',
      comparisonStartDate: '',
      comparisonEndDate: '',
      isComparisonActive: false,
      compareDisabled: false,
      comparedCustomRangesForV2: [],
      minDate: '01.01.2023',
      maxDate: new Date(),
      locale: 'tr-TR',
      formatMapping: {
        'tr-TR': 'dd.mm.yyyy',
        'en-US': 'mm/dd/yyyy',
        'default': 'dd.mm.yyyy'
      },
      customDateRanges: {
        'Q4 2024': [new Date('2024-10-01'), new Date('2024-12-31')],
        'Last Quarter': [new Date('2024-07-01'), new Date('2024-09-30')]
      }
    };
  },
  
  computed: {
    datePickerValue() {
      const main = {
        startDate: this.startDate,
        endDate: this.endDate
      };
      
      if (this.isComparisonActive && this.comparisonStartDate && this.comparisonEndDate) {
        return [
          main,
          {
            startDate: this.comparisonStartDate,
            endDate: this.comparisonEndDate
          }
        ];
      }
      
      return [main];
    },
    
    customRangesForV2() {
      return Object.entries(this.customDateRanges).map(([title, dates], index) => ({
        name: `custom${index + 1}`,
        title,
        startDate: this.formatDateToSlash(dates[0]),
        endDate: this.formatDateToSlash(dates[1])
      }));
    }
  },
  
  methods: {
    handlePeriodSelected(range) {
      // Recalculate dynamic comparison ranges
      const start = this.parseDate(range.start);
      const end = this.parseDate(range.end);
      const periodLength = Math.floor((end - start) / (1000 * 60 * 60 * 24)) + 1;
      
      // Previous Period
      const prevEnd = new Date(start);
      prevEnd.setDate(start.getDate() - 1);
      const prevStart = new Date(prevEnd);
      prevStart.setDate(prevEnd.getDate() - periodLength + 1);
      
      // Previous Period Last Year
      const lastYearStart = new Date(prevStart);
      lastYearStart.setFullYear(prevStart.getFullYear() - 1);
      const lastYearEnd = new Date(prevEnd);
      lastYearEnd.setFullYear(prevEnd.getFullYear() - 1);
      
      this.comparedCustomRangesForV2 = [{
        name: 'lastYear',
        title: 'Previous Period Last Year',
        startDate: this.formatDateToSlash(lastYearStart),
        endDate: this.formatDateToSlash(lastYearEnd)
      }];
    },
    
    handleApply(payload) {
      if (Array.isArray(payload)) {
        // With comparison
        const [mainRange, comparisonRange] = payload;
        this.applyDateRange(mainRange);
        this.applyComparisonRange(comparisonRange);
      } else {
        // Single range
        this.applyDateRange(payload);
      }
    },
    
    applyDateRange(rangeStr) {
      const [start, end] = rangeStr.split('-');
      this.startDate = this.convertToLocalFormat(start);
      this.endDate = this.convertToLocalFormat(end);
    },
    
    applyComparisonRange(rangeStr) {
      const [start, end] = rangeStr.split('-');
      this.comparisonStartDate = this.convertToLocalFormat(start);
      this.comparisonEndDate = this.convertToLocalFormat(end);
    },
    
    handleOpenComparison() {
      this.isComparisonActive = true;
    },
    
    handleCloseComparison() {
      this.isComparisonActive = false;
      this.comparisonStartDate = '';
      this.comparisonEndDate = '';
    },
    
    formatDateToSlash(date) {
      const d = new Date(date);
      const month = String(d.getMonth() + 1).padStart(2, '0');
      const day = String(d.getDate()).padStart(2, '0');
      const year = d.getFullYear();
      return `${month}/${day}/${year}`;
    },
    
    parseDate(dateStr) {
      const parts = dateStr.split(/[/.]/); 
      const isSlash = dateStr.includes('/');
      
      if (isSlash) {
        // mm/dd/yyyy
        const [month, day, year] = parts;
        return new Date(parseInt(year), parseInt(month) - 1, parseInt(day));
      } else {
        // dd.mm.yyyy
        const [day, month, year] = parts;
        return new Date(parseInt(year), parseInt(month) - 1, parseInt(day));
      }
    },
    
    convertToLocalFormat(dateStr) {
      const [month, day, year] = dateStr.split('/');
      return `${day}.${month}.${year}`;
    }
  }
};
</script>

implementationPatterns.name: Dashboard Analytics Filter
implementationPatterns.description: Date range filter with comparison for analytics
implementationPatterns.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, watch } from 'vue';
import { InDatePickerV2 } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const startDate = ref('');
const endDate = ref('');
const compareStartDate = ref('');
const compareEndDate = ref('');
const metrics = ref(null);

const customRanges = {
  'Today': [new Date(), new Date()],
  'Yesterday': [
    new Date(Date.now() - 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000),
    new Date(Date.now() - 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000)
  ],
  'Last 7 Days': [
    new Date(Date.now() - 7 * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000),
    new Date()
  ],
  'Last 30 Days': [
    new Date(Date.now() - 30 * 24 * 60 * 60 * 1000),
    new Date()
  ]
};

const fetchMetrics = async () => {
  if (!startDate.value || !endDate.value) return;
  
  const params = {
    start: startDate.value,
    end: endDate.value
  };
  
  if (compareStartDate.value && compareEndDate.value) {
    params.compareStart = compareStartDate.value;
    params.compareEnd = compareEndDate.value;
  }
  
  const response = await fetch('/api/metrics', {
    method: 'POST',
    body: JSON.stringify(params)
  });
  
  metrics.value = await response.json();
};

watch([startDate, endDate, compareStartDate, compareEndDate], () => {
  fetchMetrics();
});
</script>

<template>
  <InDatePickerV2
    id="dashboard-filter"
    name="dashboard-filter"
    label-text="Date Range"
    range
    compare
    v-model:start-date="startDate"
    v-model:end-date="endDate"
    v-model:compare-start-date="compareStartDate"
    v-model:compare-end-date="compareEndDate"
    :custom-ranges="customRanges"
  />
</template>

implementationPatterns.name: Campaign Date Selection
implementationPatterns.description: Select campaign start and end dates with validation
implementationPatterns.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';
import { InDatePickerV2 } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const startDate = ref('');
const endDate = ref('');

const minDate = Math.floor(new Date().setHours(0, 0, 0, 0) / 1000);

const state = computed(() => {
  if (!startDate.value || !endDate.value) return 'error';
  
  const start = new Date(startDate.value);
  const end = new Date(endDate.value);
  const diffDays = (end - start) / (1000 * 60 * 60 * 24);
  
  if (diffDays < 1) return 'error';
  if (diffDays > 90) return 'warning';
  return 'success';
});

const stateMessage = computed(() => {
  if (!startDate.value || !endDate.value) {
    return 'Please select campaign dates';
  }
  
  const start = new Date(startDate.value);
  const end = new Date(endDate.value);
  const diffDays = Math.round((end - start) / (1000 * 60 * 60 * 24));
  
  if (diffDays < 1) return 'End date must be after start date';
  if (diffDays > 90) return 'Campaign duration exceeds 90 days';
  return `Campaign duration: ${diffDays} days`;
});
</script>

<template>
  <InDatePickerV2
    id="campaign-dates"
    name="campaign-dates"
    label-text="Campaign Period"
    range
    v-model:start-date="startDate"
    v-model:end-date="endDate"
    :min-date="minDate"
    :state="state"
    :state-message="stateMessage"
  />
</template>

commonMistakes.mistake: Not using v-model:status for two-way binding
commonMistakes.why: Drawer needs to sync state when user closes it
commonMistakes.impact: Critical - drawer can't be reopened after user closes it
commonMistakes.fix: Use v-model:status instead of :status

commonMistakes.mistake: Using large drawer for simple content
commonMistakes.why: Wastes space, feels empty
commonMistakes.impact: Poor UX, awkward empty space
commonMistakes.fix: Use small/medium for simple forms

commonMistakes.mistake: Not handling close event cleanup
commonMistakes.why: Form data or state persists between opens
commonMistakes.impact: Old data shows when drawer reopens
commonMistakes.fix: Reset state in @onCloseEvent handler
commonMistakes.example: @onCloseEvent="() => form.value = {}"

commonMistakes.mistake: Allowing outside click close for critical actions
commonMistakes.why: Users can accidentally close during important workflows
commonMistakes.impact: Lost work, interrupted processes
commonMistakes.fix: Set closeOnOutsideClick=false for critical drawers
commonMistakes.example:
// For payment, multi-step forms:
:closeOnOutsideClick="false"

valueFormat.notes: Controls drawer visibility. When true, drawer is open/visible. When false, drawer is closed/hidden. Use v-model:status for two-way binding to reactively control drawer state.
valueFormat.example:
true // Show drawer
false // Hide drawer

commonMistakes.mistake: Not using v-model:status for two-way binding
commonMistakes.why: Drawer needs to sync state when user closes it (via X button or outside click)
commonMistakes.impact: Drawer can't be reopened after user closes it, state out of sync
commonMistakes.fix: Use v-model:status instead of :status for two-way binding

valueFormat.notes: Drawer width. Required prop. 'small' (~400px), 'medium' (~600px), 'large' (~800px). Choose based on content complexity - use small for simple forms, large for complex multi-column layouts.
valueFormat.example:
'small' // ~400px - Quick forms, filters
'medium' // ~600px - Standard forms, details
'large' // ~800px - Complex forms, multi-column

possibleValues.description: ~400px width - Quick forms, filters, simple content

valueFormat.notes: Drawer header title. Required prop. Keep concise (2-5 words). Describes drawer purpose/content. Shown in header alongside close button.
Visual state affecting header color. 'default' (neutral), 'danger' (red - for destructive actions), 'warning' (orange - for caution). Use to indicate drawer intent.
valueFormat.example:
'default' // Neutral drawer
'danger' // Delete confirmation, destructive action
'warning' // Warning, caution required

valueFormat.notes: Optional subtitle/description shown below title in header. Provides additional context about drawer purpose. Keep to 1-2 sentences.
valueFormat.example:
'Edit campaign settings and schedule'
'View and manage user permissions'
'Configure advanced filter criteria'

valueFormat.notes: When true (default), shows descriptionText below title. Set false to hide description even if descriptionText is provided.
valueFormat.example:
true // Show description (default)
false // Hide description

valueFormat.notes: When true (default), shows X close button in header. Set false to force user to use footer buttons (for critical workflows requiring confirmation).
valueFormat.example:
true // Show close button (default)
false // Hide close button (force footer actions)

valueFormat.notes: When true (default), clicking overlay (outside drawer) closes drawer. Set false for critical workflows where accidental closure should be prevented.
valueFormat.example:
true // Click outside to close (default)
false // Prevent outside click close

valueFormat.notes: When true (default), shows dark overlay behind drawer. Set false for non-modal drawers that allow interaction with background content.
valueFormat.example:
true // Show overlay (default, modal)
false // No overlay (non-modal)

valueFormat.notes: When true (default), shows footer with action buttons. Set false to hide footer for read-only/info drawers.
valueFormat.example:
true // Show footer with buttons (default)
false // Hide footer (info/read-only drawer)

valueFormat.notes: Configuration for footer action buttons. Defines button labels, variants, and click handlers. Common patterns: Cancel + Save, Close, Back + Next.
When true, content area has no padding, allowing full-width components (tables, images). Default false adds standard padding.
valueFormat.example:
true // No padding, full width
false // Standard padding (default)

onCloseEvent.description: Emitted when drawer is closed (via close button, outside click, or ESC key)
onCloseEvent.when: User closes drawer by any method. Use to cleanup state, reset forms, or trigger side effects on close.

bestPractices.title: Use v-model:status for Two-Way Binding
bestPractices.description: Always use v-model:status to sync drawer state when user closes it
bestPractices.reasoning: v-model handles close event automatically. Using :status without v-model breaks re-opening after user closes drawer.

bestPractices.title: Choose Appropriate Size for Content
bestPractices.description: Match drawer size to content complexity
bestPractices.reasoning: Too small = cramped content. Too large = wasted space. Choose size that fits content comfortably.

bestPractices.title: Use Danger State for Destructive Actions
bestPractices.description: Set state='danger' for delete/destructive confirmations
bestPractices.code:
<InDrawer
  state="danger"
  titleText="Delete Campaign"
  :closeOnOutsideClick="false"
/>
bestPractices.reasoning: Red header warns users of destructive action. Disabling outside click prevents accidental deletion.

bestPractices.title: Disable Close for Critical Workflows
bestPractices.description: Prevent accidental closure during important processes
bestPractices.code:
<InDrawer
  :closeButtonStatus="false"
  :closeOnOutsideClick="false"
  titleText="Payment Processing"
/>
bestPractices.reasoning: Critical workflows (payments, multi-step forms) shouldn't be accidentally closed. Force users to use Cancel button.

performanceNotes.description: Don't render drawer content until drawer is opened
performanceNotes.recommendation: Use v-if on InDrawer or lazy load heavy content inside drawer. Prevents rendering unused components.
performanceNotes.impact: Medium: Saves initial render time, especially with multiple drawers

performanceNotes.description: Clear heavy data structures when drawer closes
performanceNotes.recommendation: In onCloseEvent handler, clear large datasets, cancel pending requests, reset computed values.
performanceNotes.impact: Low: Prevents memory leaks in long-running sessions

accessibilityNotes.description: Focus should move to drawer when opened, return to trigger when closed
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: When drawer opens, focus first interactive element (close button or first input). When closes, return focus to button that opened it.

accessibilityNotes.description: Drawer should support ESC key to close and trap focus
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: ESC key should close drawer (unless closeButtonStatus=false for critical flow). Tab key should cycle through drawer elements only, not background.

accessibilityNotes.description: Drawer should have appropriate ARIA role and labels
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Drawer should have role='dialog' and aria-label matching titleText. Overlay should have aria-hidden='true'.

accessibilityNotes.description: Opening drawer should announce to screen readers
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Use aria-live region or focus management to announce drawer opening to screen reader users.

basicDrawer.title: Basic Drawer with Form
basicDrawer.description: Simple drawer with form and action buttons
basicDrawer.code:
<template>
  <InDrawer
    v-model:status="showDrawer"
    size="medium"
    titleText="Edit Campaign"
    descriptionText="Update campaign settings"
    :footerButtonGroupOptions="{
      primaryButton: { text: 'Save', onClick: handleSave, loading: isSaving },
      secondaryButton: { text: 'Cancel', onClick: () => showDrawer = false }
    }"
    @onCloseEvent="handleClose"
  >
    <template #contentSlot>
      <InBasicTextInput v-model="form.name" label="Campaign Name" />
      <InTextArea v-model="form.description" label="Description" />
    </template>
  </InDrawer>
</template>

<script setup>
const showDrawer = ref(false);
const isSaving = ref(false);
const form = ref({ name: '', description: '' });

const handleSave = async () => {
  isSaving.value = true;
  await api.updateCampaign(form.value);
  isSaving.value = false;
  showDrawer.value = false;
};

const handleClose = () => {
  // Reset form on close
  form.value = { name: '', description: '' };
};
</script>

commonMistakes.mistake: Not setting responseKey for API fetch
commonMistakes.solution: Set response-key to match API response structure

commonMistakes.mistake: Using wrong event name @closeList
Forgetting v-model

valueFormat.notes: Defines the dropdown items. Each option must have 'label' (display text) and 'value' (selected value). Optional: 'disabled' to prevent selection, 'description' for tooltips. For nested dropdowns, include 'children' array.
valueFormat.typescript: Array<{ label: string; value: string | number; disabled?: boolean; description?: string; children?: Array<DropdownOption> }>

valueFormat.notes: Current selected value that matches the 'value' property of an option. Use v-model for two-way binding. Can be string, number, or boolean depending on your option values. Empty string means no selection.

customOptionsKey.description: Custom property name for option label

valueFormat.notes: Maps custom property names from your data to dropdown's expected format. Use when your API returns objects with different property names than 'label' and 'value'. Example: if API returns [{name: 'John', id: 1}], use ['name', 'id'] to map name→label and id→value.

API endpoint URL to fetch dropdown options dynamically. When set, component will fetch options from this endpoint on mount or when search query changes. Use with 'responseKey' to extract data from nested responses and 'queryString' for search parameter name.

responseKey.description: JSON path to options in API response

valueFormat.notes: Dot-notation path to extract options array from API response. CRITICAL for API fetching. If API returns {data: {items: [...]}}, use 'data.items'. If response is flat array at root, leave empty or use 'data' if responseHasData=true.

Name of the query parameter for search functionality when using API fetch. The search input value will be sent as this parameter. Example: if queryString='search', API will be called with ?search=userInput. Requires searchStatus=true and fetchUrl to be set.

Forces dropdown menu to open in specific direction, overriding automatic positioning. Use 'top' to open above the button (useful when dropdown is near bottom of viewport), 'bottom' to open below. If not set, component auto-positions based on available space.

Dropdown behavior variant. 'default' for standard single-level dropdown. 'nested' enables hierarchical options with child menus (requires options with 'children' property). Use nested type for category/subcategory structures.

Visual style of the dropdown trigger button. 'dropdown' (default) for standard dropdown appearance, 'primary' for prominent actions, 'secondary' for less emphasis, 'ghost' for minimal styling. Affects button colors and borders.

Size of the dropdown trigger button. 'default' (40px height), 'small' (32px), 'large' (48px). Affects button height, padding, and font size. Use 'small' in compact UIs, 'large' for emphasis or touch-friendly interfaces.

Horizontal position (in pixels) of child dropdown menu for nested options. Only applies when type='nested'. Use string value ('left' or 'right') for relative positioning, or number for absolute pixel offset. Controls where nested submenu appears relative to parent menu.

When true, shows an 'X' button to clear the current selection and reset dropdown to empty state. Useful for optional fields where user might want to unselect. When false, selection is permanent until user picks another option.

Enables adding new options on-the-fly when user types value not in the options list. Shows 'Add new option' button in dropdown. When clicked, emits 'addNewOption' event with the typed value. Useful for tags, categories, or dynamic lists where user can create entries.

addNewOption.description: Emitted when new option is created

performanceNotes.recommendation: Use fetchUrl with search for large datasets. Enable virtual scrolling if available. Limit initial options to 50, load more on scroll or search

performanceNotes.description: Deep nesting can impact render performance

validatedDropdown.title: Dropdown with Validation States
validatedDropdown.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';
import { InDropDown } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const selectedRole = ref('');
const formSubmitted = ref(false);

const roleOptions = [
  { label: 'Admin', value: 'admin' },
  { label: 'Editor', value: 'editor' },
  { label: 'Viewer', value: 'viewer' }
];

const validationState = computed(() => {
  if (!formSubmitted.value) return {};
  
  if (!selectedRole.value) {
    return {
      invalid: true,
      invalidMessage: 'Role is required'
    };
  }
  
  return { valid: true };
});
</script>

<template>
  <InDropDown
    v-model="selectedRole"
    :options="roleOptions"
    label="User Role"
    v-bind="validationState"
  />
</template>

styling.notes: Use CSS variables for consistent theming. The component automatically handles focus, hover, and active states.

implementationPatterns.name: Dynamic API Dropdown
implementationPatterns.description: Fetch options from API with debounced search
implementationPatterns.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, watch } from 'vue';
import { debounce } from 'lodash-es';
import { InDropDown } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const selectedProduct = ref('');
const searchQuery = ref('');
const options = ref([]);
const loading = ref(false);

const fetchProducts = debounce(async (query) => {
  loading.value = true;
  try {
    const response = await fetch(`/api/products?search=${query}`);
    const data = await response.json();
    options.value = data.products.map(p => ({
      label: p.name,
      value: p.id,
      description: p.category
    }));
  } finally {
    loading.value = false;
  }
}, 300);

watch(searchQuery, fetchProducts);
</script>

<template>
  <InDropDown
    v-model="selectedProduct"
    :options="options"
    :loading="loading"
    search-status
    @search="searchQuery = $event"
  />
</template>
implementationPatterns.when: Use when options need to be fetched from API with search functionality

InDropdownMenu.name: InDropdownMenu
InDropdownMenu.title: In Dropdown Menu

optionValidationText.default: Enter a valid value to continue.

characterLimitValidationText.default: Enter a value between 1 and 10 characters to continue.

sameValueExistsValidationText.default: Same values exists. Enter a different value.

metadata.description: Dropdown menu component for navigation and actions

InDropdownMenu.typeDefs:
import { DefineComponent } from 'vue';

/**
 * Menu option structure for dropdown items.
 */
export interface MenuOption {
  /**
   * Display text for the menu item.
   */
  text: string;

  /**
   * Unique value for the menu item.
   * Returned in select event when item is clicked.
   */
  value: string | number;

  /**
   * Optional icon name to display with the menu item.
   * Icon names should match InIcons component icon set.
   *
   * @example icon="user"
   * @example icon="settings"
   */
  icon?: string;

  /**
   * Nested submenu items.
   * Creates a hierarchical menu structure.
   *
   * @example
   * children: [
   *   { text: 'Export as PDF', value: 'pdf' },
   *   { text: 'Export as CSV', value: 'csv' }
   * ]
   */
  children?: MenuOption[];

  /**
   * Whether this menu item is disabled.
   * Disabled items are visible but not clickable.
   *
   * @default false
   */
  disabled?: boolean;

  /**
   * Whether this menu item is a divider (separator line).
   * When true, renders a horizontal line instead of a menu item.
   *
   * @default false
   */
  divider?: boolean;
}

/**
 * InDropdownMenu component props.
 */
export interface InDropdownMenuProps {
  /**
   * Unique identifier for the dropdown menu element.
   *
   * @required
   * @example id="user-menu"
   * @example id="actions-dropdown"
   */
  id: string;

  /**
   * Array of menu items to display.
   * Supports nested items via children property.
   *
   * @required
   * @example
   * :options="[
   *   { text: 'Profile', value: 'profile', icon: 'user' },
   *   { text: 'Settings', value: 'settings', icon: 'settings' },
   *   { text: 'Logout', value: 'logout', icon: 'logout' }
   * ]"
   *
   * @example
   * // With nested submenu
   * :options="[
   *   { text: 'New', value: 'new', icon: 'plus' },
   *   {
   *     text: 'Export',
   *     value: 'export',
   *     icon: 'download',
   *     children: [
   *       { text: 'PDF', value: 'export-pdf' },
   *       { text: 'CSV', value: 'export-csv' }
   *     ]
   *   }
   * ]"
   */
  options: MenuOption[];

  /**
   * Controls the open/close state of the dropdown.
   * Use to programmatically show or hide the menu.
   *
   * @default false
   * @example :status="isMenuOpen"
   * @example :status="showDropdown"
   */
  status?: boolean;

  /**
   * Enables search/filter functionality in the dropdown.
   * Shows a search input at the top of the menu.
   *
   * @default false
   * @example :search-status="true"
   */
  searchStatus?: boolean;

  /**
   * Shows loading indicator in the dropdown.
   * Useful for async data loading scenarios.
   *
   * @default false
   * @example :loading-state="isFetchingOptions"
   */
  loadingState?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Event handler types for InDropdownMenu.
 */
export interface InDropdownMenuEventHandlers {
  /**
   * Handler for select event when menu item is clicked.
   * Receives the value of the selected menu item.
   *
   * @param value - The value of the selected menu item
   * @example
   * const handleSelect = (value: string | number) => {
   *   console.log('Selected:', value);
   *   if (value === 'logout') {
   *     performLogout();
   *   }
   * }
   */
  onSelect?: (value: string | number) => void;

  /**
   * Handler for search event when search input changes.
   * Only emitted when searchStatus is true.
   *
   * @param query - Search query string
   * @example
   * const handleSearch = (query: string) => {
   *   filteredOptions.value = options.filter(opt =>
   *     opt.text.toLowerCase().includes(query.toLowerCase())
   *   );
   * }
   */
  onSearch?: (query: string) => void;
}

/**
 * InDropdownMenu Component
 *
 * Flexible dropdown menu component with nested submenus, icons,
 * search functionality, and keyboard navigation.
 *
 * @example
 * // Basic dropdown menu
 * <InDropdownMenu
 *   id="actions"
 *   :options="[
 *     { text: 'Edit', value: 'edit', icon: 'edit' },
 *     { text: 'Delete', value: 'delete', icon: 'trash' }
 *   ]"
 *   :status="menuOpen"
 *   @select="handleAction"
 * />
 *
 * @example
 * // User profile menu
 * <template>
 *   <button @click="toggleMenu">
 *     {{ userName }}
 *   </button>
 *
 *   <InDropdownMenu
 *     id="profile-menu"
 *     :options="profileOptions"
 *     :status="menuOpen"
 *     @select="handleMenuAction"
 *   />
 * </template>
 *
 * <script setup>
 * import { ref } from 'vue';
 *
 * const menuOpen = ref(false);
 * const profileOptions = [
 *   { text: 'Profile', value: 'profile', icon: 'user' },
 *   { text: 'Settings', value: 'settings', icon: 'settings' },
 *   { divider: true },
 *   { text: 'Logout', value: 'logout', icon: 'logout' }
 * ];
 *
 * const toggleMenu = () => {
 *   menuOpen.value = !menuOpen.value;
 * };
 * </script>
 *
 * @example
 * // Nested submenu
 * <InDropdownMenu
 *   id="file-menu"
 *   :options="[
 *     { text: 'New', value: 'new', icon: 'plus' },
 *     {
 *       text: 'Export',
 *       value: 'export',
 *       icon: 'download',
 *       children: [
 *         { text: 'Export as PDF', value: 'export-pdf' },
 *         { text: 'Export as CSV', value: 'export-csv' },
 *         { text: 'Export as JSON', value: 'export-json' }
 *       ]
 *     },
 *     { text: 'Print', value: 'print', icon: 'printer' }
 *   ]"
 *   :status="fileMenuOpen"
 *   @select="handleFileAction"
 * />
 *
 * @example
 * // With search functionality
 * <InDropdownMenu
 *   id="searchable-menu"
 *   :options="users"
 *   :status="isOpen"
 *   :search-status="true"
 *   @select="selectUser"
 *   @search="filterUsers"
 * />
 *
 * @example
 * // With loading state
 * <InDropdownMenu
 *   id="async-menu"
 *   :options="menuItems"
 *   :status="isOpen"
 *   :loading-state="isLoading"
 *   @select="handleSelect"
 * />
 *
 * @example
 * // TypeScript usage
 * import type { InDropdownMenuEventHandlers, MenuOption } from './InDropdownMenu';
 *
 * const options: MenuOption[] = [
 *   { text: 'Option 1', value: 'opt1', icon: 'check' },
 *   { text: 'Option 2', value: 'opt2', disabled: true }
 * ];
 *
 * const handlers: InDropdownMenuEventHandlers = {
 *   onSelect: (value) => console.log('Selected:', value),
 *   onSearch: (query) => console.log('Searching:', query)
 * };
 */
declare const InDropdownMenu: DefineComponent<InDropdownMenuProps>;

export default InDropdownMenu;

implementationPatterns.name: Column Filter Menu
implementationPatterns.description: Multi-select filter for table columns
implementationPatterns.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';
import { InDropdownMenu } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const allColumns = [
  { text: 'Name', value: 'name' },
  { text: 'Email', value: 'email' },
  { text: 'Status', value: 'status' },
  { text: 'Created', value: 'created' }
];

const visibleColumns = ref(['name', 'email', 'status']);

const toggleColumn = (column) => {
  const index = visibleColumns.value.indexOf(column.value);
  if (index === -1) {
    visibleColumns.value.push(column.value);
  } else {
    visibleColumns.value.splice(index, 1);
  }
};

const selectAll = (columns) => {
  visibleColumns.value = columns.map(c => c.value);
};

const clearAll = () => {
  visibleColumns.value = [];
};
</script>

<template>
  <InDropdownMenu
    id="column-filter"
    button-label="Columns"
    selection-type="multiple"
    :options="allColumns"
    :pre-selected-values="visibleColumns"
    select-all-option-status
    @optionClick="toggleColumn"
    @selectAllOptions="selectAll"
    @resetAllOptions="clearAll"
  />
</template>
implementationPatterns.when: Implementing customizable table column visibility

implementationPatterns.name: Bulk Actions Menu
implementationPatterns.description: Actions for multiple selected items
implementationPatterns.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';
import { InDropdownMenu } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const selectedItems = ref<number[]>([]);

const bulkActions = computed(() => {
  const count = selectedItems.value.length;
  return [
    { 
      text: `Delete ${count} items`, 
      value: 'delete', 
      icon: 'trash',
      disabled: count === 0
    },
    { 
      text: `Export ${count} items`, 
      value: 'export', 
      icon: 'download',
      disabled: count === 0
    },
    { 
      text: 'Mark as read', 
      value: 'mark-read', 
      icon: 'check',
      disabled: count === 0
    }
  ];
});

const handleBulkAction = async (action) => {
  const ids = selectedItems.value;
  
  switch(action.value) {
    case 'delete':
      await bulkDelete(ids);
      selectedItems.value = [];
      break;
    case 'export':
      await bulkExport(ids);
      break;
    case 'mark-read':
      await bulkMarkRead(ids);
      break;
  }
};
</script>

<template>
  <InDropdownMenu
    id="bulk-actions"
    :button-label="`Bulk Actions (${selectedItems.length})`"
    :options="bulkActions"
    :disabled="selectedItems.length === 0"
    @optionClick="handleBulkAction"
  />
</template>
implementationPatterns.when: Providing actions for multiple selected items
cons: Can be complex with mixed item types

commonMistakes.mistake: Using duplicate IDs for events or attributes
commonMistakes.why: Component uses IDs for selection state tracking and data mapping
commonMistakes.impact: Selection state breaks, wrong items get selected/deselected, data corruption
commonMistakes.fix: Ensure every item has a globally unique ID, use prefixes like 'event_', 'attr_', 'partner_'

commonMistakes.mistake: Not enabling lazy loading for large datasets
commonMistakes.why: Rendering 1000+ items at once causes severe performance issues
commonMistakes.impact: UI freezes, slow scrolling, high memory usage, poor user experience
commonMistakes.fix: Enable lazy loading with appropriate chunk sizes for datasets over 200 items
commonMistakes.example:
// WRONG - renders all 1000 items immediately
<InDynamicContentBox :fieldsConfig="{ events: thousand Items }" />

// CORRECT - lazy loads in chunks
<InDynamicContentBox
  :fieldsConfig="{ events: thousandItems }"
  :lazyLoadChunkSize="100"
  :preloadBunchSize="10"
/>

commonMistakes.mistake: Missing categories for events and attributes
commonMistakes.why: Component groups items by category for better organization
commonMistakes.impact: All items appear in 'Uncategorized', difficult to find items, poor UX
commonMistakes.fix: Always provide meaningful category values for events and attributes

commonMistakes.mistake: Not handling button callbacks properly
commonMistakes.why: Button actions often involve async operations that can fail
commonMistakes.impact: Errors swallowed silently, user thinks action succeeded when it failed, data loss
commonMistakes.fix: Implement proper error handling and user feedback in all button callbacks

commonMistakes.mistake: Forgetting to sync dynamicContent with v-model
commonMistakes.why: Component needs two-way binding to update parent state
commonMistakes.impact: Selections don't persist, parent component doesn't know what's selected
commonMistakes.fix: Use v-model:dynamicContent for two-way binding

valueFormat.notes: Configuration object defining the structure and behavior of dynamic content fields. Specifies available events, attributes, partners, and their metadata. Critical for controlling what content can be inserted.

commonMistakes.mistake: Not providing unique IDs for events and attributes
commonMistakes.why: Causes selection conflicts and duplicate entries in UI
commonMistakes.impact: Users cannot distinguish between similar items, selection state breaks
commonMistakes.fix: Ensure every event and attribute has a unique id property

valueFormat.notes: Currently selected dynamic content items. Represents the user's selections of events, attributes, and partners. Use v-model:dynamicContent for two-way binding.
Visual theme for the component. Affects background colors and contrast.
Color variant for visual styling and semantic meaning.
Size variant affecting spacing, typography, and overall dimensions.
Enables partner-level grouping/filtering. When true, shows partner selection UI and filters events/attributes by selected partners.
List of available partners for grouping/filtering. Only effective when hasGroupLevelPartners is true.
Enables constant/persistent event features. When true, shows UI for marking events as constants that persist across sessions/contexts.
Enables constant/persistent attribute features. When true, shows UI for marking attributes as constants.
Enables event grouping functionality. When true, shows checkbox/UI to toggle event grouping mode.
Current state of event grouping. When true, events are grouped. Use v-model:isGroupingEvents for two-way binding.
List of event IDs that should be displayed in grouped mode. Only relevant when isGroupingEvents is true.
Configuration for action buttons displayed in the component (save, cancel, clear, etc.). Defines button labels, variants, and callbacks.
Maximum height in pixels for scrollable content areas. When content exceeds this height, a scrollbar appears.
Number of items to load per chunk when lazy loading large lists. Improves performance for hundreds/thousands of events or attributes.
Number of chunks to preload ahead of current scroll position. Reduces perceived lag during scrolling.

setEventAsGrouped.description: Emitted when an event is added to or removed from the grouped events list
setEventAsGrouped.payload: { eventId: string | number, isGrouped: boolean } - Event ID and new grouped state
setEventAsGrouped.when: User toggles an event's grouped status in the UI

updateGroupingEvents.description: Emitted when the overall event grouping mode is toggled on or off
updateGroupingEvents.payload: boolean - New grouping state (true if grouping is now active)
updateGroupingEvents.when: User toggles the group events checkbox or grouping mode changes

bestPractices.title: Use Unique IDs for All Items
bestPractices.description: Ensure every event, attribute, and partner has a unique identifier to prevent selection conflicts
bestPractices.reasoning: Unique IDs prevent selection state bugs, ensure correct data mapping, and avoid confusion in the UI

bestPractices.title: Enable Lazy Loading for Large Datasets
bestPractices.description: Use lazyLoadChunkSize and preloadBunchSize when dealing with hundreds of events or attributes
bestPractices.code:
// For large catalogs (500+ items)
<InDynamicContentBox
  :fieldsConfig="largeEventCatalog"
  :lazyLoadChunkSize="100" // Load 100 items at a time
  :preloadBunchSize="10" // Preload 10 chunks ahead
  :maxChildHeight="400" // Fixed height for virtual scrolling
/>

// Result: Handles 1000+ items smoothly
bestPractices.reasoning: Lazy loading dramatically improves performance, reduces initial load time, and enables smooth scrolling with large datasets

bestPractices.title: Mark Critical Fields as Constant
bestPractices.description: Use isConstant flag for events/attributes that must always be tracked for data integrity
bestPractices.reasoning: Constant fields prevent accidental removal of critical data, ensure data consistency, and maintain referential integrity

bestPractices.title: Provide Clear Action Buttons
bestPractices.description: Configure buttonOptions with clear labels and appropriate variants for user actions
bestPractices.reasoning: Clear buttons guide users through the workflow, prevent accidental actions (via confirmation), and provide predictable outcomes

performanceNotes.description: Component supports lazy loading for large datasets to maintain performance
performanceNotes.recommendation: For datasets over 200 items, use lazyLoadChunkSize (50-100) and preloadBunchSize (5-10). For 1000+ items, use lazyLoadChunkSize=100 and preloadBunchSize=10.
performanceNotes.impact: Proper lazy loading can reduce initial render time from 5+ seconds to under 500ms for large datasets

performanceNotes.description: Setting maxChildHeight enables virtual scrolling for better performance
performanceNotes.recommendation: Set maxChildHeight to a reasonable value (300-500px) to enable virtual scrolling. Don't set it too large as it defeats the purpose.
performanceNotes.impact: Virtual scrolling can handle 10,000+ items smoothly while maintaining 60fps

performanceNotes.description: Avoid expensive operations in event handlers (setEventAsGrouped, updateGroupingEvents)
performanceNotes.recommendation: If handlers perform expensive operations (API calls, complex calculations), debounce them or use async queuing.
performanceNotes.impact: Unbounded event handlers can cause UI lag during rapid selection changes

accessibilityNotes.description: Component supports full keyboard navigation for selecting events and attributes
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Ensure Tab, Arrow keys, Space, and Enter work for all selections. Test with keyboard-only navigation.
accessibilityNotes.example:
// Component handles keyboard navigation automatically
// Test: Tab through items, Space/Enter to select, Arrow keys to navigate lists

accessibilityNotes.description: Selection changes and grouping state should be announced to screen readers
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Use aria-live regions for dynamic selection updates. Ensure labels clearly describe item purpose.

accessibilityNotes.description: Focus should be managed when opening/closing sections or applying filters
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Return focus to trigger element after modal-like interactions. Maintain focus within component during keyboard navigation.

accessibilityNotes.description: All interactive elements need clear, descriptive labels
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Use titleText and descriptionText props. Provide tooltips for complex features. Use meaningful button labels.
accessibilityNotes.example:
<InDynamicContentBox
  titleText="Configure Analytics Events"
  descriptionText="Select which user actions to track in your analytics platform"
  groupEventsTooltip="Group similar events together for simplified reporting"
/>

<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref } from 'vue';

const selections = ref({
  selectedEvents: [],

withGrouping.title: Event Grouping Configuration
withGrouping.description: Enable event grouping with custom messages
withGrouping.code:
<template>
  <InDynamicContentBox
    id="grouped-events-selector"
    v-model:dynamicContent="selections"
    v-model:isGroupingEvents="isGrouping"
    :fieldsConfig="fieldsConfig"
    :activateGroupingEvents="true"
    :groupedEvents="groupedEventIds"
    groupEventsCheckboxLabel="Enable grouped event tracking"
    groupEventsTooltip="Group related events together for better organization"
    groupingEventWarningText="Grouping will combine similar events"
    @updateGroupingEvents="handleGroupingChange"
    @setEventAsGrouped="handleEventGrouped"
  />
</template>

<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref } from 'vue';
import { InDynamicContentBox } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const selections = ref({
  selectedEvents: ['page_view', 'product_view'],
  selectedAttributes: []
});

const isGrouping = ref(false);
const groupedEventIds = ref<string[]>([]);

const fieldsConfig = {
  events: [
    { id: 'page_view', name: 'page_view', label: 'Page View' },
    { id: 'product_view', name: 'product_view', label: 'Product View' },
    { id: 'category_view', name: 'category_view', label: 'Category View' },
    { id: 'search', name: 'search', label: 'Search' }
  ]
};

const handleGroupingChange = (enabled: boolean) => {
  console.log('Grouping', enabled ? 'enabled' : 'disabled');
  if (!enabled) {
    groupedEventIds.value = [];
  }
};

const handleEventGrouped = (event: { eventId: string; isGrouped: boolean }) => {
  if (event.isGrouped) {
    groupedEventIds.value.push(event.eventId);
  } else {
    groupedEventIds.value = groupedEventIds.value.filter(id => id !== event.eventId);
  }
};
</script>

implementationPatterns.description: Configuration with multiple analytics partners and partner-specific filtering

<template>

    id="multi-partner-config"

<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref, watch } from 'vue';
import { InDynamicContentBox } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const config = ref({ selectedEvents: [], selectedPartners: [] });
const partners = ref([
  { id: 'ga', name: 'ga', label: 'Google Analytics' },
  { id: 'fb', name: 'fb', label: 'Facebook' }
]);
const fields = { events: [...], attributes: [...] };

const syncPartnerConfig = (selectedPartners: string[]) => {
  // Sync config to each partner's system
  selectedPartners.forEach(partnerId => {
    syncToPartner(partnerId, config.value);
  });
};
</script>

implementationPatterns.name: Lazy Loading for Large Datasets Pattern
implementationPatterns.description: Performance-optimized configuration for hundreds or thousands of events/attributes
implementationPatterns.when: Dealing with large catalogs of events or attributes (500+ items)
implementationPatterns.code:
<template>
  <InDynamicContentBox
    id="large-dataset-config"
    v-model:dynamicContent="selections"
    :fieldsConfig="lazyFields"
    :lazyLoadChunkSize="100"
    :preloadBunchSize="10"
    :maxChildHeight="400"
  />
</template>

<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';
import { InDynamicContentBox } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const selections = ref({ selectedEvents: [] });

// Generate large dataset
const allEvents = Array.from({ length: 1000 }, (_, i) => ({
  id: `event_${i}`,
  name: `event_${i}`,
  label: `Event ${i}`,
  category: `Category ${Math.floor(i / 100)}`
}));

const lazyFields = computed(() => ({
  events: allEvents,
  attributes: []
}));
</script>

useCases.title: Marketing Analytics Platform Setup
useCases.description: Configure tracking events and user attributes for marketing analytics platforms like Google Analytics, Facebook Pixel, or Mixpanel
useCases.example: Marketing teams select which page views, button clicks, form submissions, and purchases to track. They choose user attributes (email, name, country) and product attributes (price, category) to include with each event. Partner filtering ensures only relevant events are sent to each platform.

useCases.title: Customer Data Platform (CDP) Configuration
useCases.description: Set up event and attribute mappings for CDPs to unify customer data across touchpoints
useCases.example: Data engineers configure which customer interaction events (login, purchase, support ticket) to ingest. They map customer attributes (lifetime value, segment, preferences) to create unified profiles. Constant attributes ensure critical IDs are always included.

useCases.title: A/B Testing Platform Integration
useCases.description: Select events and metrics for A/B testing experiments and variant tracking
useCases.example: Product managers choose conversion events (signup, purchase, retention) as experiment goals. They select user attributes (device type, location) for segmentation. Event grouping combines similar conversions for broader analysis.

useCases.title: Business Intelligence Dashboard Configuration
useCases.description: Choose metrics and dimensions for business intelligence dashboards and reports
useCases.example: Analysts select revenue events (purchase, subscription, upsell) and business attributes (product line, region, channel). They group related events (all purchase types) for unified reporting. Lazy loading handles thousands of potential metrics.

useCases.title: Data Warehouse ETL Setup
useCases.description: Configure which events and attributes to extract, transform, and load into data warehouses
useCases.example: Data engineers select operational events (inventory updates, order status changes) and business entities (products, customers, orders). Constant attributes ensure referential integrity. Partner selection routes data to different warehouse schemas.

useCases.title: Privacy Compliance Configuration
useCases.description: Manage which events and PII attributes are collected based on privacy regulations (GDPR, CCPA)
useCases.example: Compliance teams use constant attributes to mark required consent fields. They disable certain PII attributes (email, phone) for users who opt out. Event selection ensures only necessary tracking for legitimate business purposes.

commonMistakes.mistake: Forgetting v-model:status binding

commonMistakes.mistake: Not handling button events

commonMistakes.mistake: Using wrong state for destructive actions
commonMistakes.why: Visual cue doesn't match action severity
commonMistakes.impact: User may not realize action is destructive

commonMistakes.mistake: Allowing outside click for critical actions

valueFormat.notes: Use v-model:status for two-way binding to open/close modal. True shows modal, false hides it. Automatically syncs with close events. Prefer v-model over manual :status binding for proper state management.

commonMistakes.mistake: Using :status instead of v-model:status
commonMistakes.impact: Modal won't close when user clicks X or outside
commonMistakes.fix: Use v-model:status for two-way binding

valueFormat.notes: Controls modal appearance and context. 'default' (neutral gray), 'primary' (blue, info), 'warning' (yellow, caution), 'danger' (red, destructive actions). Affects header color and footer button styling.

Determines modal width. 'small' (~400px, forms), 'medium' (~600px, default), 'large' (~800px, detailed content), 'x-large' (~1000px, complex forms). Responsive on mobile - all sizes become full-width.
Main heading displayed in modal header. Keep concise (1-5 words). For custom title with icons or actions, use headerTitleSlot instead. Supports XSS prevention when preventXss=true.
Subtitle or helper text shown below title when descriptionStatus=true. Use for brief context (1-2 sentences). For longer descriptions, use default slot content.

Defines footer action buttons. Properties: cancelButton (back/cancel), secondaryButton (optional middle), primaryButton (main action). Each has: labelText, type ('primary'|'secondary'|'danger'), styling ('solid'|'outline'), disabled, loading. Buttons emit corresponding events.
valueFormat.typescript: { cancelButton?: ButtonConfig; secondaryButton?: ButtonConfig; primaryButton?: ButtonConfig; }

commonMistakes.mistake: Not listening to button events
commonMistakes.impact: Buttons don't do anything when clicked
commonMistakes.fix: Listen to @primaryButtonEvent, @secondaryButtonEvent, @cancelOrBackButtonEvent

valueFormat.notes: When true (default), clicking outside modal closes it. Set to false for critical actions (delete confirmations) to force user to click Cancel or X. Works with v-model:status.

closeButtonStatus.description: Show/hide X close button in header

valueFormat.notes: When true (default), shows X button in top-right. Set false for mandatory actions requiring explicit button choice. Emits @onCloseEvent when clicked.
When true (default), shows footer with buttons from footerButtonGroupOptions. Set false when using custom footer via footerSlot or for information-only modals.
When true, removes default content padding for full-width elements like tables, lists, or images. Use when content needs to extend edge-to-edge within modal.

onCloseEvent.description: Fired when X button or Escape key pressed
onCloseEvent.when: User clicks X button in header or presses Escape key

cancelOrBackButtonEvent.when: User clicks the cancel button in footer (defined in footerButtonGroupOptions.cancelButton)

secondaryButtonEvent.when: User clicks the secondary button in footer (optional middle button)

primaryButtonEvent.description: Fired when primary action button clicked
primaryButtonEvent.when: User clicks the primary button in footer (main action button)

implementationPatterns.name: Stacked Modals Pattern
implementationPatterns.description: Opening a modal from within another modal
implementationPatterns.code:
<script setup>
import { ref } from 'vue';
import { InModalV2 } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const showEditModal = ref(false);
const showConfirmModal = ref(false);
const hasUnsavedChanges = ref(true);

const handleCloseEdit = () => {
  if (hasUnsavedChanges.value) {
    showConfirmModal.value = true;
  } else {
    showEditModal.value = false;
  }
};

const handleConfirmDiscard = () => {
  showConfirmModal.value = false;
  showEditModal.value = false;
  hasUnsavedChanges.value = false;
};
</script>

<template>
  <!-- Main edit modal -->
  <InModalV2
    v-model:status="showEditModal"
    title-text="Edit Profile"
    @onCloseEvent="handleCloseEdit"
  >
    <form>
      <!-- Form fields -->
    </form>
  </InModalV2>
  
  <!-- Confirmation modal (stacked on top) -->
  <InModalV2
    v-model:status="showConfirmModal"
    state="warning"
    size="small"
    title-text="Unsaved Changes"
    description-text="You have unsaved changes. Discard them?"
    :footer-button-group-options="{
      cancelButton: { labelText: 'Keep Editing' },
      primaryButton: { labelText: 'Discard', type: 'warning' }
    }"
    @primaryButtonEvent="handleConfirmDiscard"
    @cancelOrBackButtonEvent="showConfirmModal = false"
  />
</template>
implementationPatterns.when: Use when confirmation is needed before closing a modal with unsaved changes

commonMistakes.mistake: Not handling XSS in user-generated content
commonMistakes.why: Modal may display user input without sanitization
commonMistakes.impact: Critical XSS vulnerability allowing script injection and account compromise
commonMistakes.fix: Always set preventXss: true when displaying user-provided content
commonMistakes.example:
// WRONG
<InModals :informationModalDescription="userComment" />

// CORRECT
<InModals
  :informationModalDescription="userComment"
  :preventXss="true"
/>

commonMistakes.mistake: Missing error handling in accept button handler
commonMistakes.why: Async operations can fail
commonMistakes.impact: Silent failures, modal stuck open, no user feedback
commonMistakes.fix: Wrap async operations in try-catch and handle errors

commonMistakes.mistake: Using closeOnOverlayClick for forms
commonMistakes.why: Users accidentally click overlay while entering data
commonMistakes.impact: Frustrating data loss, poor UX
commonMistakes.fix: Set closeOnOverlayClick: false for forms and confirm before close

commonMistakes.mistake: Not disabling accept button during loading
commonMistakes.why: Users can click multiple times
commonMistakes.impact: Duplicate submissions, multiple API calls, race conditions
commonMistakes.fix: Use isModalAcceptButtonLoading or acceptButtonDisable

commonMistakes.mistake: Displaying user-generated content without preventXss

deleteWarning.title: Destructive Action Warning
deleteWarning.code:
<template>
  <InModals
    v-model:status="showDeleteWarning"
    type="warning"
    modalStatus="danger"
    size="medium"
    title="Delete Item"
    informationModalDescription="This action cannot be undone. All data associated with this item will be permanently deleted."
    acceptButtonText="Delete Permanently"
    acceptButtonType="BUTTON_TYPE_DANGER"
    cancelButtonText="Cancel"
    :closeOnOverlayClick="false"
    @acceptButton="handleDelete"
    @closeModal="showDeleteWarning = false"
  />
</template>

<script setup lang="ts">
import { ref } from 'vue';
import { InModals } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const showDeleteWarning = ref(false);

const handleDelete = async () => {
  try {
    await deleteItem();
    showDeleteWarning.value = false;
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Delete failed:', error);
  }
};

const deleteItem = async () => {
  // API call
  await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 1000));
};
</script>

</template>

<script setup lang="ts">
interface Props {
  show: boolean;
  title: string;
  message: string;
  onConfirm: () => void;
}

defineProps<Props>();
</script>
cons: May annoy users if too frequent

implementationPatterns.name: Form Modal Pattern
implementationPatterns.description: Modal containing a form with validation and submission
implementationPatterns.when: Quick edits, creation flows, or forms that don't need dedicated pages
implementationPatterns.code:
<template>
  <InModals
    v-model:status="show"
    type="form"
    :title="title"
    acceptButtonText="Save"
    :acceptButtonDisable="!isValid"
    :isModalAcceptButtonLoading="saving"
    :closeOnOverlayClick="false"
    @acceptButton="handleSubmit"
  >
    <slot :form="form" :errors="errors" />
  </InModals>
</template>

<script setup lang="ts">
const form = ref({});
const errors = ref({});
const isValid = computed(() => validate(form.value));
</script>

implementationPatterns.name: Multi-Step Wizard Pattern
implementationPatterns.description: Guided workflow split across multiple modal pages
implementationPatterns.when: Complex workflows like onboarding, setup wizards, or multi-stage processes
implementationPatterns.code:
<template>
  <InModals
    v-model:status="show"
    :withPage="true"
    :withBackOption="step > 0"
    :title="steps[step].title"
    :acceptButtonText="step === steps.length - 1 ? 'Finish' : 'Next'"
    @acceptButton="nextStep"
    @back="prevStep"
  >
    <component :is="steps[step].component" />
  </InModals>
</template>

commonMistakes.mistake: Not setting responseKey for API fetch
commonMistakes.solution: Set response-key to match your API response structure

commonMistakes.mistake: Using disable instead of disabled in options
Forgetting v-model for two-way binding

valueFormat.notes: Defines the multi-select items. Each option must have 'label' (display text) and 'value' (selected value). Optional: 'disabled' to prevent selection. For type='checkbox', checkboxes appear next to each option. For type='tags', options show as removable tags when selected.
valueFormat.typescript: Array<{ label: string; value: string | number; disabled?: boolean; }>
valueFormat.example: :options="[{ label: 'Option 1', value: '1' }, { label: 'Option 2', value: '2', disabled: true }]"

commonMistakes.mistake: Using 'text' instead of 'label' for option display
commonMistakes.impact: Options won't display - component expects 'label' property
commonMistakes.fix: Use 'label' property: { label: 'Text', value: 'val' }

valueFormat.notes: Array of currently selected values that match the 'value' properties of selected options. Use v-model for two-way binding. Empty array means no selection. Component automatically adds/removes values when user selects/deselects options.

customOptionsKey.description: Custom property name for option label

valueFormat.notes: Maps custom property names from your data to dropdown's expected format. Use when your API returns objects with different property names than 'label' and 'value'. Example: if API returns [{name: 'John', id: 1}], use ['name', 'id'] to map name→label and id→value. Same as InDropDown.

commonMistakes.mistake: Not setting when options have different label key
commonMistakes.impact: Options don't display correctly - shows undefined or [Object object]
commonMistakes.fix: Map your property names: :custom-options-key="['yourLabelKey', 'yourValueKey']"

fetchUrl.description: API endpoint for fetching options dynamically

valueFormat.notes: API endpoint URL to fetch dropdown options dynamically. When set, component will fetch options from this endpoint on mount or when search query changes. Use with 'responseKey' to extract data from nested responses and 'queryString' for search parameter name.

responseKey.description: JSON path to options array in API response

valueFormat.notes: Dot-notation path to extract options array from API response. CRITICAL for API fetching. If API returns {data: {items: [...]}}, use 'data.items'. If response is flat array at root, leave empty or use 'data' if responseHasData=true.

Name of the query parameter for search functionality when using API fetch. The search input value will be sent as this parameter. Example: if queryString='search', API will be called with ?search=userInput. Requires searchStatus=true and fetchUrl to be set.

maxSelectableItem.description: Maximum number of items that can be selected

valueFormat.notes: Limits the number of options that can be selected. When limit is reached, remaining options become disabled and warningMessage is displayed. Use 0 (default) for unlimited selection. Useful for enforcing business rules like 'select up to 5 categories'.

addNewTagStatus.description: Allow creating new options by typing

valueFormat.notes: Enables adding new options on-the-fly when user types value not in the options list. Shows 'Create new' button in dropdown. When clicked, emits 'addNewOption' event with the typed value. Subject to character limits (minimumNewTagCharacterLimit, maxNewTagCharacterLimit).

minimumNewTagCharacterLimit.description: Minimum characters required for new tag

valueFormat.notes: Minimum length required for creating new tags. Default is 2. 'Create new' option only appears when typed text length >= this value. Prevents accidentally creating single-character or empty tags.

maxNewTagCharacterLimit.description: Maximum characters allowed for new tag

valueFormat.notes: Maximum length allowed for creating new tags. Empty string ('') means no limit. When limit is reached, user cannot type more characters. Use to enforce tag naming standards or database constraints.

hasTemporaryOptions.description: Allow temporary options that aren't persisted

valueFormat.notes: When true, newly created options are marked as temporary and may not be persisted to backend. Useful for client-side filtering or preview functionality where new options shouldn't be saved to database immediately.

Controls visual representation of selections. 'checkbox' (default) shows checkboxes next to options, useful for traditional multi-select. 'tags' displays selected items as removable tag chips above dropdown, better for space-constrained UIs.
Visual color theme. 'grey' (default) for standard gray styling, 'light' for lighter background, 'dark' for dark mode. Affects dropdown background, borders, and text colors.

addNewOption.description: Emitted when new option is created

performanceNotes.description: Rendering 100+ checkboxes can slow dropdown opening
performanceNotes.recommendation: Use fetchUrl with search for large datasets. Limit initial options to 50. Enable search when options > 20 for better UX

performanceNotes.description: Many selected tags (20+) can slow UI updates
performanceNotes.recommendation: Set reasonable maxSelectableItem limit (5-10). Consider using chip list component for displaying many tags outside dropdown

performanceNotes.description: Computing filtered results on every selection change
performanceNotes.recommendation: Debounce filter computations if expensive. Use computed properties with proper dependency tracking. Consider memoization for complex filters

accessibilityNotes.description: Multi-selects must have associated labels
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Always provide label prop. Component automatically links label to button with aria-labelledby

accessibilityNotes.description: Checkboxes must be keyboard accessible and properly labeled
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Component handles checkbox keyboard interaction (Space to toggle). Each checkbox is linked to its label. Use type='checkbox' for better screen reader support
accessibilityNotes.example: type="checkbox" // Better for screen readers than tags

accessibilityNotes.description: Screen readers should announce number of selected items
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Component automatically updates aria-label with selected count (e.g., '3 items selected'). Keep maxSelectableItem reasonable for easier tracking

accessibilityNotes.description: Tag remove buttons need proper labels
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: When type='tags', each tag's remove button has aria-label='Remove [option label]'. Keyboard accessible with Delete/Backspace keys

apiMultiDropDown.title: Multi-Select with API Data
apiMultiDropDown.description: Fetch options from API with search and validation
apiMultiDropDown.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';
import { InMultiDropDown } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const selectedUsers = ref([]);
const formSubmitted = ref(false);

const validationState = computed(() => {
  if (!formSubmitted.value) return {};
  
  if (selectedUsers.value.length === 0) {
    return {
      invalid: true,
      invalidMessage: 'Please select at least one user'
    };
  }
  
  if (selectedUsers.value.length > 5) {
    return {
      warning: true,
      warningMessage: 'Selecting more than 5 users may impact performance'
    };
  }
  
  return {};
});
</script>

<template>
  <InMultiDropDown
    v-model="selectedUsers"
    label="Assign Users"
    fetch-url="/api/users"
    response-key="data.users"
    :custom-options-key="['name', 'id']"
    search-status
    query-string="search"
    type="checkbox"
    :max-selectable-item="10"
    v-bind="validationState"
  />
</template>

styling.notes: Tag styling is automatically applied when type='tags'. Checkbox styling uses design system checkbox component.

implementationPatterns.name: Limited Multi-Select
implementationPatterns.description: Multi-select with maximum selection limit
implementationPatterns.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';
import { InMultiDropDown } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const selectedTags = ref([]);
const maxTags = 3;

const tagOptions = [
  { label: 'Feature', value: 'feature' },
  { label: 'Bug', value: 'bug' },
  { label: 'Enhancement', value: 'enhancement' },
  { label: 'Documentation', value: 'docs' },
  { label: 'Testing', value: 'test' }
];

const selectionWarning = computed(() => {
  if (selectedTags.value.length >= maxTags) {
    return `Maximum ${maxTags} tags allowed`;
  }
  return '';
});
</script>

<template>
  <InMultiDropDown
    v-model="selectedTags"
    :options="tagOptions"
    label="Issue Tags"
    type="tags"
    :max-selectable-item="maxTags"
    :warning="selectedTags.length >= maxTags"
    :warning-message="selectionWarning"
  />
</template>

commonMistakes.mistake: Using InMultiSelect like InSelect (single selection)
commonMistakes.impact: Not utilizing multi-selection capability
commonMistakes.fix: value prop should be array with MULTIPLE items, handle selection/deselection properly

commonMistakes.mistake: Not providing feedback on selection limit

valueFormat.objectShape: { text: string, value: any, disabled?: boolean, description?: string, icon?: string }
examples: [{ text: 'Active', value: 'active', icon: 'check' }, { text: 'Pending', value: 'pending', disabled: true }]
[{ text: 'Turkey', value: 'TR', description: 'Turkey region' }, { text: 'USA', value: 'US' }]
valueFormat.notes: CRITICAL: Property is 'text' not 'label'! Each option must have unique value for proper multi-selection tracking.
valueFormat.typescript: Array<{ text: string; value: any; disabled?: boolean; description?: string; icon?: string }>

commonMistakes.mistake: Using 'label' instead of 'text' property
commonMistakes.impact: Options won't display, shows empty dropdown
commonMistakes.fix: Change { label: 'X' } to { text: 'X' }

commonMistakes.mistake: Passing array of strings instead of objects
commonMistakes.impact: Component expects objects with text/value
commonMistakes.fix: Transform ['opt1', 'opt2'] to [{ text: 'opt1', value: 'opt1' }]

commonMistakes.mistake: Not providing unique values for multi-select
commonMistakes.impact: Selection tracking fails, can't distinguish between selected items
commonMistakes.fix: Ensure each option has unique value property

commonMistakes.mistake: Not handling disabled options
commonMistakes.impact: Disabled items can still be selected
commonMistakes.fix: Add disabled: true to option object

examples: [{ text: 'Active', value: 'active' }, { text: 'Pending', value: 'pending' }, { text: 'Done', value: 'done' }]
valueFormat.notes: CRITICAL: Always array for multi-selection. Empty array = no selection. Can contain MULTIPLE selected option objects.

commonMistakes.mistake: Passing single object instead of array
commonMistakes.impact: Type error, multi-selection won't work
commonMistakes.fix: Always wrap in array: [selectedOption] even for single selection

commonMistakes.mistake: Passing array of values only (without text)
commonMistakes.impact: Selected items won't display properly
commonMistakes.fix: Use array of objects: [{ text: 'Display', value: actualValue }]

commonMistakes.mistake: Not limiting selection count
commonMistakes.impact: Users can select unlimited items
commonMistakes.fix: Use maxSelectableItem prop to limit selections

commonMistakes.mistake: Not handling de-selection
commonMistakes.impact: Can't remove selected items
commonMistakes.fix: Update value array by filtering out de-selected item

valueFormat.notes: Maximum number of items user can select. Unlimited if not set.

commonMistakes.mistake: Setting to 0 or negative number
commonMistakes.impact: No items can be selected
commonMistakes.fix: Use positive number (1, 2, 3...) or don't set for unlimited

valueFormat.notes: Enable search/filter functionality within dropdown
Show 'Select All' option at top of dropdown for multi-select
Allow creating new options on the fly

commonMistakes.mistake: Enabling without optionValidationType
commonMistakes.impact: All text allowed, might break validation
commonMistakes.fix: Set optionValidationType: 'text' or 'number' or custom RegExp

valueFormat.notes: Visual state for validation feedback

select.useCase: Emitted for each selection/deselection. Update value array by adding or removing this option

commonMistakes.mistake: Replacing entire value array instead of adding/removing
commonMistakes.impact: Multi-selection breaks, only keeps last selected item
commonMistakes.fix: Use array spread and filter: [...value, newOption] or value.filter()

commonMistakes.mistake: Not checking if item already selected
commonMistakes.impact: Duplicate selections, can't de-select
commonMistakes.fix: Check with .some() before adding, use .filter() to remove

change.useCase: Emitted with full array of selected options. Easier than 'select' event for simple cases

onRemoveTag.useCase: Emitted when user removes a selected item via tag. Remove this item from value array

withSearch.title: Searchable Multi-Select
withSearch.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';

const allOptions = ref(/* 100+ options */);
const searchQuery = ref('');
const selected = ref([]);

const filteredOptions = computed(() => {
  if (!searchQuery.value) return allOptions.value;
  return allOptions.value.filter(opt => 
    opt.text.toLowerCase().includes(searchQuery.value.toLowerCase())
  );
});
</script>

<template>
  <InMultiSelect
    label-text="Search and Select"
    search-status
    :options="filteredOptions"
    :value="selected"
    @search="searchQuery = $event"
    @change="selected = $event"
  />
</template>

withLimit.title: Limited Selection
withLimit.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';

const selected = ref([]);
const maxItems = 3;

const state = computed(() => 
  selected.value.length >= maxItems ? 'warning' : 'default'
);

const stateMessage = computed(() => 
  selected.value.length >= maxItems 
    ? `Maximum ${maxItems} items selected` 
    : ''
);
</script>

<template>
  <InMultiSelect
    label-text="Select up to 3"
    :options="options"
    :value="selected"
    :max-selectable-item="maxItems"
    :state="state"
    :state-message="stateMessage"

  />

implementationPatterns.name: Form Multi-Select with Validation
implementationPatterns.description: Multi-select in form with validation
implementationPatterns.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';
import { InMultiSelect } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const selectedCategories = ref([]);
const minRequired = 2;

const state = computed(() => {
  if (selectedCategories.value.length === 0) return 'default';
  if (selectedCategories.value.length < minRequired) return 'error';
  return 'success';
});

const stateMessage = computed(() => {
  if (selectedCategories.value.length < minRequired) {
    return `Please select at least ${minRequired} categories`;
  }
  return '';
});

const categories = [
  { text: 'Technology', value: 'tech' },
  { text: 'Business', value: 'business' },
  { text: 'Science', value: 'science' },
  { text: 'Arts', value: 'arts' }
];
</script>

<template>
  <form>
    <InMultiSelect
      id="categories"
      label-text="Select Categories"
      :options="categories"
      :value="selectedCategories"
      :state="state"
      :state-message="stateMessage"
      @change="selectedCategories = $event"
    />
  </form>
</template>
implementationPatterns.when: Multi-select with minimum/maximum requirements
cons: Can be verbose for complex rules

implementationPatterns.name: Tag Management
implementationPatterns.description: Create and manage tags with multi-select
implementationPatterns.code:
<script setup>
import { ref } from 'vue';
import { InMultiSelect } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const allTags = ref([
  { text: 'Important', value: 'important' },
  { text: 'Urgent', value: 'urgent' },
  { text: 'Review', value: 'review' }
]);

const itemTags = ref([]);

const createTag = (tagName: string) => {
  const newTag = {
    text: tagName,
    value: tagName.toLowerCase().replace(/\s+/g, '-')
  };
  
  // Add to available tags
  allTags.value.push(newTag);
  
  // Auto-select the new tag
  itemTags.value.push(newTag);
};
</script>

<template>
  <InMultiSelect
    id="tag-manager"
    label-text="Tags"
    :options="allTags"
    :value="itemTags"
    create-option-status
    option-validation-type="text"
    create-button-label="Create Tag"
    search-status
    @change="itemTags = $event"
    @addOption="createTag"
  />
</template>
implementationPatterns.when: User-generated tags or categories
