commonMistakes.mistake: Using same generic empty state everywhere
commonMistakes.why: Different contexts need different messaging
commonMistakes.impact: Users confused about what's missing and what to do
commonMistakes.fix: Create contextual empty states with specific titles and descriptions

commonMistakes.mistake: Enabling parseAsHtml without preventXss for user content
commonMistakes.why: Creates XSS security vulnerability
commonMistakes.impact: Malicious users can inject scripts and compromise security
commonMistakes.fix: Always use preventXss=true with parseAsHtml=true when content includes user input

commonMistakes.mistake: Not handling filtered empty states differently
commonMistakes.why: Empty because of filters vs truly empty are different scenarios
commonMistakes.impact: Users don't know if they should create data or adjust filters
commonMistakes.fix: Check if filters are active and adjust message accordingly

commonMistakes.mistake: Showing action button when user lacks permission
commonMistakes.why: User clicks button but gets permission error
commonMistakes.impact: Frustrating UX, wasted clicks
commonMistakes.fix: Hide button or disable it with tooltip explaining why

valueFormat.notes: Main heading text for the empty state. Should be concise and describe what is missing. Keep to 3-7 words for best UX.
valueFormat.example:
'No campaigns found'
'Your inbox is empty'
'No results'

commonMistakes.mistake: Using generic 'No data' for all empty states
commonMistakes.why: Generic messages don't provide context about what's missing
commonMistakes.impact: Users don't understand what they're looking for or why it's empty
commonMistakes.fix: Use specific, contextual titles like 'No campaigns created yet' instead of 'No data'

valueFormat.notes: Supporting text that explains why the empty state exists and what users can do. Can include HTML if parseAsHtml=true. Should guide users to next action.
valueFormat.example:
'Create your first campaign to start engaging with customers'
'Try adjusting your filters or search terms'
'You haven\'t received any notifications yet'

valueFormat.notes: Controls whether to show the empty state icon. Default is true. Set to false for minimal empty states with only text.
valueFormat.example:
true // Show icon (default)
false // Text-only empty state

valueFormat.notes: Icon name from Insider icon system. Default is 'no-data'. Choose contextually appropriate icons (e.g., 'search' for no search results, 'inbox' for empty inbox).
valueFormat.example:
'no-data' // Default empty state icon
'search' // No search results
'inbox-empty' // Empty inbox
'folder-open' // No files

valueFormat.notes: When true, displays a call-to-action button below the description. Use with buttonText to provide primary action (e.g., 'Create Campaign', 'Add Item').
valueFormat.example:
true // Show action button
false // No button (default)

valueFormat.notes: Label for the action button (requires buttonStatus=true). Should be action-oriented and specific (e.g., 'Create Campaign' not 'Click here').
Additional props passed to the InButton component. Can include variant, size, loading, etc. Use to customize button appearance and behavior.
valueFormat.typescript: { variant?: string; size?: string; loading?: boolean; [key: string]: any; }

valueFormat.notes: Button variant type. Default is 'primary'. Common values: 'primary', 'secondary', 'tertiary', 'outline'.
valueFormat.example:
'primary' // Primary action (default)
'secondary' // Secondary action
'outline' // Outline button style

valueFormat.notes: Disables the action button. Use when action is temporarily unavailable (e.g., loading, insufficient permissions). Pair with buttonTooltip to explain why.
valueFormat.example:
true // Disable button
false // Enable button (default)

valueFormat.notes: Tooltip text shown on button hover. Especially useful when button is disabled to explain why (e.g., 'Insufficient permissions').
valueFormat.example:
'Insufficient permissions to create campaigns'
'Complete setup to enable this feature'

valueFormat.notes: Tooltip position relative to button. Default is 'top center'. Format: '{vertical} {horizontal}'.
When true, renders description as HTML instead of plain text. Allows links, formatting, etc. Always use with preventXss=true for user-generated content.
valueFormat.example:
true // Render HTML
false // Plain text (default)

commonMistakes.mistake: Setting parseAsHtml=true without preventXss=true for user content
commonMistakes.why: Opens XSS vulnerability if description contains user input
commonMistakes.impact: Security vulnerability - malicious scripts can execute
commonMistakes.fix: Always enable preventXss=true when parseAsHtml=true with user content

valueFormat.notes: When true, sanitizes HTML to prevent XSS attacks. MUST be true when parseAsHtml=true and description contains any user-generated content.
valueFormat.example:
true // Sanitize HTML (use with parseAsHtml)
false // No sanitization (default)

valueFormat.notes: CSS class for background color. Default is 'b-c-4' (background-color-4 from Insider DS). Use Insider color utility classes.
valueFormat.example:
'b-c-4' // Default light background
'b-c-white' // White background
'b-c-transparent' // Transparent

valueFormat.notes: CSS class for title text color. Default is 't-c-1' (text-color-1, darkest text). Use Insider text color utility classes.
CSS class for description text color. Default is 't-c-2' (text-color-2, secondary text). Use Insider text color utility classes.
valueFormat.example:
't-c-2' // Default (secondary text)
't-c-3' // Even lighter
't-c-muted' // Muted text

valueFormat.notes: CSS class(es) applied to icon container. Default is 'mb-3' (margin-bottom-3). Use Insider spacing utility classes.
valueFormat.example:
'mb-3' // Default spacing
'mb-4' // More space below icon
'mb-2 opacity-50' // Less space, semi-transparent

bestPractices.title: Use Specific, Contextual Titles
bestPractices.description: Avoid generic 'No data' - describe what's specifically missing
bestPractices.code:
// Good:
title="No campaigns found"
title="No search results"
title="Your inbox is empty"

// Bad:
title="No data"
title="Empty"
bestPractices.reasoning: Specific titles help users understand what they're looking at and reduce confusion. Generic messages provide no context.

bestPractices.title: Provide Actionable Descriptions
bestPractices.description: Guide users on what to do next, don't just state the problem
bestPractices.reasoning: Users need guidance, not just problem statements. Tell them how to resolve the empty state.

bestPractices.title: Show Action Buttons Strategically
bestPractices.description: Only show action buttons when user can and should take action
bestPractices.reasoning: Don't show action buttons users can't use. It's frustrating. For permission issues, explain in description instead.

bestPractices.title: Always Sanitize User-Generated HTML
bestPractices.description: Use preventXss=true when parseAsHtml=true with any user input
bestPractices.reasoning: XSS vulnerabilities can compromise entire application. Always sanitize user-generated HTML content.

performanceNotes.description: HTML sanitization (preventXss) has performance cost for large content
performanceNotes.recommendation: Use parseAsHtml only when necessary. For simple text, use plain strings. Cache sanitized HTML if content doesn't change often.
performanceNotes.impact: Low: Only affects complex HTML descriptions

performanceNotes.description: Show empty state only when truly needed using v-if
performanceNotes.recommendation: Use v-if instead of v-show for empty states since they're shown rarely. Prevents rendering when data exists.
performanceNotes.impact: Low: Minor optimization for data-heavy pages

accessibilityNotes.description: Empty state should have proper heading hierarchy
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Ensure title uses appropriate heading level (h2, h3) based on page structure. Don't skip heading levels.
accessibilityNotes.example: <InNoData title="No campaigns" /> should render as <h2> or <h3> depending on context

accessibilityNotes.description: Button text should be descriptive, not generic
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Use specific button text like 'Create Campaign' instead of 'Click Here' or 'Get Started'
accessibilityNotes.example:
buttonText="Create Campaign" // Good
buttonText="Click Here" // Bad - not descriptive

accessibilityNotes.description: Empty state icon needs proper alt text for screen readers
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Ensure icon has aria-label or is marked as decorative with aria-hidden='true' if purely visual

accessibilityNotes.description: When using parseAsHtml, ensure HTML is accessible
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Links in HTML descriptions need descriptive text. Avoid 'click here'. Lists should use proper <ul>/<ol> markup.

implementationPatterns.name: API Response Feedback
implementationPatterns.description: Show success/error after API calls
implementationPatterns.code:
<script setup>
import { ref } from 'vue';
import { InOnPageMessage } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const message = ref<{ type: string; text: string } | null>(null);

const saveData = async () => {
  try {
    await api.save(data);
    message.value = {
      type: 'success',
      text: 'Data saved successfully'
    };
  } catch (error) {
    message.value = {
      type: 'error',
      text: 'Failed to save data. Please try again.'
    };
  }
  
  // Auto-dismiss after 5 seconds
  setTimeout(() => {
    message.value = null;
  }, 5000);
};
</script>

<template>
  <InOnPageMessage
    v-if="message"
    :type="message.type"
    size="medium"
    :title-text="message.text"
  />
</template>
implementationPatterns.when: Providing feedback after async operations

implementationPatterns.name: Feature Announcements
implementationPatterns.description: Highlight new features or important info
implementationPatterns.code:
<script setup>
import { ref } from 'vue';
import { InOnPageMessage } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const showAnnouncement = ref(true);

const dismissAnnouncement = () => {
  showAnnouncement.value = false;
  localStorage.setItem('feature-announcement-dismissed', 'true');
};

const mounted = () => {
  const dismissed = localStorage.getItem('feature-announcement-dismissed');
  showAnnouncement.value = !dismissed;
};
</script>

<template>
  <InOnPageMessage
    v-if="showAnnouncement"
    type="info"
    size="large"
    title-text="New feature: Bulk export"
    description-text="You can now export multiple items at once."
    link-status
    link-text="Learn more"
    @link-click="openDocs"
  >
    <template #extraMessage>
      <button @click="dismissAnnouncement">Dismiss</button>
    </template>
  </InOnPageMessage>
</template>
implementationPatterns.when: Announcing new features or important updates

examples.title: Multi-Step Process with Progress
examples.description: Show progress through a multi-step workflow

commonMistakes.mistake: Not clamping progress value to maxValue
commonMistakes.why: Progress calculations can exceed 100% due to rounding or errors
commonMistakes.impact: Progress bar overflows visually or shows incorrect completion state
commonMistakes.fix: Always clamp: Math.min(currentValue, maxValue)

commonMistakes.mistake: Using 'default' variant for unknown-duration tasks
commonMistakes.why: Cannot track actual progress for API calls, auth flows, etc.
commonMistakes.impact: Progress stuck at 0%, users think app is frozen
commonMistakes.fix: Use variant='indeterminate' when progress is unknown

commonMistakes.mistake: Not handling error states
commonMistakes.why: Operations fail (network errors, timeouts, validation failures)
commonMistakes.impact: Progress stuck indefinitely, no way to recover
commonMistakes.fix: Always implement invalid state with retry option

commonMistakes.mistake: Forgetting to show success confirmation
commonMistakes.why: Users need visual confirmation of successful completion
commonMistakes.impact: Unclear if operation succeeded, users may retry unnecessarily
commonMistakes.fix: Set success=true when complete, show for 1-2 seconds

valueFormat.notes: Current progress value. Must be between 0 and maxValue. Represents the completed portion of the task. For percentage-based progress, use 0-100 range with maxValue=100 (default).
valueFormat.example:
45 // 45% complete when maxValue=100
3 // 3 of 10 steps when maxValue=10

commonMistakes.mistake: Setting value greater than maxValue
commonMistakes.why: Progress bar should not exceed 100% completion
commonMistakes.impact: Visual overflow or progress bar appearing full when task incomplete
commonMistakes.fix: Ensure value <= maxValue, clamp value programmatically

valueFormat.notes: Maximum value representing 100% completion. Default is 100 for percentage-based progress. Use custom values for step-based progress (e.g., maxValue=5 for 5-step process).
valueFormat.example:
100 // Percentage-based (0-100)
10 // 10 steps total
500 // 500 files to process

valueFormat.notes: Progress bar variant. 'default': shows definite progress with value. 'indeterminate': animated loading indicator when progress is unknown (ignores value prop).

possibleValues.description: Determinate progress bar showing exact percentage/value
Animated loading indicator for unknown duration tasks

commonMistakes.mistake: Using variant='default' when progress is unknown
commonMistakes.why: Showing 0% or stuck progress confuses users
commonMistakes.impact: Users think process is frozen or not working
commonMistakes.fix: Use variant='indeterminate' for unknown-duration tasks

valueFormat.notes: When true, displays progress as semi-circle/gauge instead of linear bar. Useful for dashboard widgets and compact displays. Works with semiCircleWidth prop.
valueFormat.example:
true // Show as gauge/semi-circle
false // Show as linear bar (default)

valueFormat.notes: Width in pixels for semi-circle progress (only applies when semiCircle=true). Default is 300px. Adjusts both width and height proportionally.
When true, shows success state with green color and success icon. Use when progress reaches 100% or task completes successfully. Overrides normal progress display.
Message displayed in success state (requires success=true). Shows alongside success icon to confirm completion.
Icon name shown in success state. Default is 'line-check-neutral'. Use Insider icon system names.
When true, shows error/invalid state with red color and error icon. Use when task fails or encounters error during progress.
Error message displayed in invalid state (requires invalid=true). Explains what went wrong.
valueFormat.example:
'Upload failed - file too large'
'Processing error at step 3'

valueFormat.notes: How to display the invalid state. 'button': shows retry button with icon (emits click event). 'text': shows text message only.
valueFormat.example:
'button' // Show retry button
'text' // Show error message only

valueFormat.notes: Icon name shown in invalid state. Default is 'line-redo' (retry icon). Use Insider icon system names.
When true, shows description text alongside progress bar. Use with description prop to provide context about the ongoing task.
valueFormat.example:
true // Show description
false // Hide description (default)

valueFormat.notes: Description text shown when descriptionStatus=true. Provides context about what's being processed. Can include dynamic content like current step or filename.
valueFormat.example:
'Uploading report.pdf...'
'Processing 45 of 100 records'
'Step 3 of 5: Analyzing data'

valueFormat.notes: Position of description text relative to progress bar. Default is 'left'.
valueFormat.example:
'left' // Description on left (default)
'top' // Description above progress bar
'bottom' // Description below progress bar

valueFormat.notes: Alternative way to show completion state. Similar to success but without requiring success message/icon. Use for simple completion indication.

click.description: Emitted when user clicks the progress component (typically the retry button in invalid state)
click.when: User clicks retry button when invalid=true and invalidType='button'. Use to retry failed operation.

helperFunctions.name: useProgressTracker
helperFunctions.description: Composable for managing progress state with success/error handling
helperFunctions.returnType: { progress: Ref<number>, isSuccess: Ref<boolean>, isError: Ref<boolean>, errorMessage: Ref<string>, isProcessing: Ref<boolean>, percentage: ComputedRef<number>, start: Function, increment: Function, setProgress: Function, complete: Function, fail: Function, reset: Function }

helperFunctions.name: createProgressFromPromise
helperFunctions.description: Track progress of array of promises with automatic state management
helperFunctions.returnType: Promise<{ results: PromiseSettledResult[], errors: Array, succeeded: number, failed: number }>

bestPractices.title: Always Provide Descriptive Feedback
bestPractices.description: Use descriptionStatus with meaningful messages about what's happening
bestPractices.code:
<InProgress
  :value="progress"
  :descriptionStatus="true"
  :description="`Processing ${currentFile} (${filesProcessed} of ${totalFiles})`"
/>
bestPractices.reasoning: Generic progress bars without context create anxiety. Users need to know what's being processed and why it's taking time.

bestPractices.title: Choose Correct Variant Based on Knowledge
bestPractices.description: Use 'default' only when you can track actual progress, otherwise use 'indeterminate'
bestPractices.reasoning: Showing 0% progress or stuck percentages is worse than showing indeterminate loading. Don't fake progress.

bestPractices.title: Implement Retry for Network Operations
bestPractices.description: Always provide retry option for operations that can fail
bestPractices.code:
<InProgress
  :invalid="hasError"
  :invalidMessage="errorMessage"
  :invalidType="'button'"
  @click="retryOperation"
/>
bestPractices.reasoning: Network failures are common. Forcing users to restart entire flows is poor UX. Retry button saves time and frustration.

bestPractices.title: Show Success State Briefly Before Hiding
bestPractices.description: Display success state for 1-2 seconds before removing progress indicator
bestPractices.reasoning: Instant removal of progress can feel abrupt. Brief success confirmation provides closure and confirms completion.

performanceNotes.description: Don't update progress on every byte/item, it causes excessive re-renders
performanceNotes.recommendation: Update progress in meaningful increments (5-10%) or throttle updates to every 100-200ms
performanceNotes.impact: High: Rapid progress updates can freeze UI on slow devices

performanceNotes.description: Multiple animated progress bars impact performance
performanceNotes.recommendation: Limit visible indeterminate progress bars to 2-3 max. Consider using skeleton loaders for long lists.
performanceNotes.impact: Medium: CSS animations for multiple progress bars consume CPU

performanceNotes.description: Progress tracking intervals must be cleared when component unmounts
performanceNotes.recommendation: Use onBeforeUnmount to clear intervals/timeouts. Consider using composables with automatic cleanup.
performanceNotes.impact: Medium: Memory leaks from uncleaned intervals

accessibilityNotes.description: Progress component should have proper ARIA attributes for screen readers
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Ensure component has role='progressbar', aria-valuenow, aria-valuemin, aria-valuemax, and aria-label

accessibilityNotes.description: Indeterminate progress needs aria-busy attribute
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Add aria-busy='true' for indeterminate variant so screen readers announce loading state

accessibilityNotes.description: State changes should be announced to screen reader users
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Use aria-live regions to announce success/error messages. Set aria-live='polite' for non-critical updates.

accessibilityNotes.description: Retry button in error state needs descriptive label
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Ensure retry button has clear aria-label explaining what will be retried

basicProgress.title: Basic Progress Bar
basicProgress.code:
<template>
  <InProgress
    id="upload-progress"
    :value="uploadProgress"
    :maxValue="100"
    :descriptionStatus="true"
    :description="`Uploading... ${uploadProgress}%`"
  />
</template>

<script setup>
const uploadProgress = ref(0);

// Simulate upload progress
const simulateUpload = () => {
  const interval = setInterval(() => {
    uploadProgress.value += 10;
    if (uploadProgress.value >= 100) {
      clearInterval(interval);
    }
  }, 500);
};
</script>

progressWithStates.title: Progress with Success/Error States
progressWithStates.code:
<template>
  <InProgress
    id="file-process"
    :value="progress"
    :maxValue="100"
    :success="isSuccess"
    :successMessage="'All files processed successfully!'"
    :invalid="isError"
    :invalidMessage="errorMessage"
    :invalidType="'button'"
    @click="retryProcess"
  />
</template>

<script setup>
const progress = ref(0);
const isSuccess = ref(false);
const isError = ref(false);
const errorMessage = ref('');

const processFiles = async () => {
  try {
    isError.value = false;
    for (let i = 0; i <= 100; i += 20) {
      progress.value = i;
      await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 500));
      
      // Simulate random error
      if (Math.random() > 0.8) {
        throw new Error('Processing failed at ' + i + '%');
      }
    }
    isSuccess.value = true;
  } catch (error) {
    isError.value = true;
    errorMessage.value = error.message;
  }
};

const retryProcess = () => {
  progress.value = 0;
  isError.value = false;
  processFiles();
};
</script>

semiCircleGauge.title: Semi-Circle Gauge Progress

cssVariables.--progress-bg-color: Background color of the progress track

styling.notes: Semi-circle variant uses SVG rendering. Indeterminate variant shows animated loading pattern. Success and invalid states override the default progress color.

implementationPatterns.name: Determinate Progress (Known Duration)
implementationPatterns.description: Use when you can calculate exact progress percentage
implementationPatterns.code:
<InProgress
  id="file-upload"
  :value="bytesUploaded"
  :maxValue="totalBytes"
  variant="default"
  :descriptionStatus="true"
  :description="`${Math.round(bytesUploaded / totalBytes * 100)}% uploaded`"
/>
implementationPatterns.when: File uploads, batch processing with known item count, paginated data loading, step-by-step wizards
pros: Clear user expectation of completion time
cons: Can stall if progress calculation is wrong

implementationPatterns.name: Indeterminate Progress (Unknown Duration)
implementationPatterns.description: Use when you cannot predict completion time
implementationPatterns.code:
<InProgress
  id="api-call"
  variant="indeterminate"
  :descriptionStatus="true"
  description="Loading data..."
/>
implementationPatterns.when: API calls without progress info, database queries, authentication flows, any operation with unpredictable duration
pros: No need to track exact progress
cons: May cause anxiety for long operations

implementationPatterns.name: Progress with Retry Pattern
implementationPatterns.description: Allow users to retry failed operations
implementationPatterns.code:
<InProgress
  id="process"
  :value="progress"
  :invalid="hasError"
  :invalidMessage="errorMessage"
  :invalidType="'button'"
  @click="retryOperation"
/>

const retryOperation = async () => {
  progress.value = 0;
  hasError.value = false;
  await startOperation();
};
implementationPatterns.when: Network-dependent operations, file uploads, data synchronization, any failable async task
pros: No need to restart entire flow

useCases.title: File Upload Progress Tracking
useCases.description: Show real-time progress for single or multiple file uploads
useCases.example: Document management system where users upload reports, images, or datasets. Show individual progress bars for each file with success/error states and retry capability.

useCases.title: Dashboard KPI Gauges
useCases.description: Display performance metrics as semi-circle progress gauges
useCases.example: Marketing dashboard showing campaign completion rate, goal achievement percentage, budget utilization. Use semi-circle gauges for compact, at-a-glance metrics.

useCases.title: Multi-Step Workflow Progress
useCases.description: Track progress through sequential process steps
useCases.example: Data import wizard: validate → parse → verify → import → finalize. Show current step progress with descriptions and handle step failures with retry.

useCases.title: Background Task Monitoring
useCases.description: Show progress of long-running background operations
useCases.example: Report generation, data export, batch email sending. Use indeterminate progress initially, switch to determinate when progress info becomes available.

InRichTextInput.name: InRichTextInput
InRichTextInput.title: In Rich Text Input

metadata.description: Rich text editor with formatting toolbar

InRichTextInput.typeDefs:
import { DefineComponent } from 'vue'; /** * Available toolbar button options for the rich text editor. */ export type ToolbarButton = | 'bold' | 'italic' | 'underline' | 'strike' | 'heading1' | 'heading2' | 'heading3' | 'bulletList' | 'orderedList' | 'alignLeft' | 'alignCenter' | 'alignRight' | 'alignJustify' | 'link' | 'image' | 'blockquote' | 'codeBlock' | 'undo' | 'redo' | 'clear'; /** * InRichTextInput component props. */ export interface InRichTextInputProps { /** * Unique identifier for the editor element. * Required for proper editor initialization and lifecycle. * * @required * @example id="content-editor" * @example id="blog-post-editor" */ id: string; /** * HTML content of the editor. * Use with v-model for two-way binding. * * @required * @example value="

Initial content

" * @example :value="articleContent" */ value: string; /** * Placeholder text shown when editor is empty. * * @default '' * @example placeholder="Start typing..." * @example placeholder="Write your blog post here..." */ placeholder?: string; /** * Disables the editor, preventing user interaction. * Editor content becomes read-only. * * @default false * @example :disabled="isReadOnly" * @example :disabled="!canEdit" */ disabled?: boolean; /** * Array of toolbar button names to display. * When not provided, all toolbar buttons are shown. * Order of buttons follows the array order. * * @default All buttons * @example * :toolbar="['bold', 'italic', 'underline']" * * @example * // Minimal toolbar for comments * :toolbar="['bold', 'italic', 'link']" * * @example * // Full-featured blog editor * :toolbar="[ * 'bold', 'italic', 'underline', 'strike', * 'heading1', 'heading2', 'heading3', * 'bulletList', 'orderedList', * 'alignLeft', 'alignCenter', 'alignRight', * 'link', 'image', 'blockquote', 'codeBlock', * 'undo', 'redo', 'clear' * ]" */ toolbar?: ToolbarButton[]; } /** * Event handler types for InRichTextInput. */ export interface InRichTextInputEventHandlers { /** * Handler for input event (content changes). * Emitted on every content modification. * * @param html - Updated HTML content * @example * const handleInput = (html: string) => { * content.value = html; * console.log('Content updated:', html); * } */ onInput?: (html: string) => void; /** * Handler for change event (on blur). * Emitted when editor loses focus with updated content. * * @param html - Final HTML content * @example * const handleChange = (html: string) => { * saveContent(html); * } */ onChange?: (html: string) => void; } /** * InRichTextInput Component * * WYSIWYG rich text editor component with customizable toolbar, * text formatting, lists, links, images, and HTML output. * * @example * // Basic usage * * * @example * // Custom toolbar for blog posts * * * @example * // Minimal toolbar for comments * * * @example * // Email composer * * * * * @example * // Read-only preview mode * * * @example * // TypeScript usage * import type { InRichTextInputEventHandlers } from './InRichTextInput'; * * const handlers: InRichTextInputEventHandlers = { * onInput: (html) => console.log('Content:', html), * onChange: (html) => saveToServer(html) * }; */ declare const InRichTextInput: DefineComponent; export default InRichTextInput;

commonMistakes.mistake: Not sanitizing HTML output before saving
commonMistakes.why: User input can contain malicious scripts
commonMistakes.impact: XSS vulnerability, security risk
commonMistakes.fix: Use @purify event or sanitize before saving to database

commonMistakes.mistake: Incorrect character counting with HTML tags
commonMistakes.why: HTML tags inflate character count
commonMistakes.impact: Inaccurate length validation
commonMistakes.fix: Strip HTML tags before counting: content.replace(/<[^>]*>/g, '')

commonMistakes.mistake: Not handling merge tag max lengths
commonMistakes.why: Merge tags expand to variable-length values
commonMistakes.impact: Content exceeds limits when tags are replaced
commonMistakes.fix: Calculate with max expected length for each tag
commonMistakes.example:
// Replace {{name}} with max length estimate
const estimated = text.replace(/{{name}}/g, 'X'.repeat(50));

valueFormat.notes: HTML/rich text content with embedded dynamic content tags. Use v-model for two-way binding. Content can include toolbar formatting (bold, italic, links), dynamic tags ({{attribute}}), and WhatsApp styling (*bold*, _italic_) if enabled. Listen to @purify event to get sanitized output for saving.

Label text displayed above the rich text editor. Shown when labelStatus=true. Use clear, descriptive labels to help users understand the field purpose (e.g., 'Message Content', 'Email Body', 'SMS Text').

dynamicContentList.description: Available dynamic content attributes - replaces V1 attributeList

valueFormat.notes: CRITICAL: Defines insertable dynamic content/merge tags for personalized messages. Each attribute needs 'label' (shown in dropdown) and 'value' (inserted as {{value}}). Optional: 'category' for grouping, 'icon' for visual distinction. Used for email templates, SMS campaigns, push notifications with user data. Example: user selects 'First Name', {{first_name}} gets inserted and later replaced with actual name.
valueFormat.typescript: Array<{ label: string; value: string; category?: string; icon?: string; }>

commonMistakes.mistake: Using attributeList from V1
commonMistakes.impact: Prop not recognized - no dynamic content available in dropdown
commonMistakes.fix: Change to dynamicContentList: :dynamic-content-list="attributes"

valueFormat.notes: Defines which formatting tools appear in the editor toolbar. Common options: 'bold', 'italic', 'underline' for text styling, 'link' for URLs, 'emoji' for emoji picker, 'dynamicContent' for merge tags. Customize based on use case: SMS uses minimal ['bold', 'italic', 'dynamicContent'], email uses full formatting. Order in array determines button order.

Controls what appears in the editor footer area. 'counter' shows character/word count (requires characterCounterStatus=true), 'label' displays footerLabel text, 'tags' shows list of used dynamic content tags. Useful for giving users real-time feedback on message length and dynamic content usage.

Validation rules for rich text content. maxLength enforces character limit (critical for SMS 160 chars), minLength requires minimum content, segmentLength shows message segmentation for SMS (each segment = 160 chars). Validation messages appear via states/stateMessage props. Essential for channels with strict length limits.
valueFormat.typescript: { maxLength?: number; minLength?: number; segmentLength?: number; }

valueFormat.notes: When true, enables validation feedback based on helperTextValidationConfig rules. Shows warning/error states when limits are approached or exceeded. Use with states and stateMessage props to provide user feedback. Essential for enforcing content constraints.

Visual validation state for the editor. 'default' for normal, 'success' for valid, 'warning' for approaching limits (e.g., 150/160 chars), 'error' for invalid/exceeded limits. Replaces V1's separate invalid and warning boolean props. Use with stateMessage to explain the validation issue.

Explanatory message shown with validation state. Appears below editor when states is set to warning/error. Provide clear, actionable feedback: 'Required field', 'Maximum 160 characters', 'Message will be split into 2 SMS'. Critical for user understanding of validation rules.
valueFormat.example: state-message="Message exceeds SMS limit and will be split into multiple messages"

characterCounterStatus.description: Show character counter - replaces V1 isCounter

valueFormat.notes: Shows character/word count in footer. Requires footerOptions to include 'counter'. Count respects helperTextValidationConfig.maxLength (e.g., '45/160'). Essential for SMS (160 char limit), Twitter-like interfaces, or any character-limited content. Use customCounter for custom counting logic.

Limits how many dynamic content tags can be inserted into the message. 0 (default) means unlimited. When limit reached, dynamic content button becomes disabled. Useful for enforcing business rules like 'max 5 personalization fields per SMS' or preventing over-personalization that hurts deliverability.

isDynamicContentOnly.description: Only allow dynamic content (no free text)

valueFormat.notes: When true, users can ONLY insert dynamic content tags - no free text allowed. Useful for strict templating scenarios where content must be entirely composed of predefined attributes. Example: webhook payload builder where only valid field names are allowed.
valueFormat.example: is-dynamic-content-only // Only {{tags}} allowed, no free text

canOnlyReplaceDynamicContent.description: Only allow replacing existing dynamic content

valueFormat.notes: When true, users cannot add NEW dynamic content tags, only replace/edit existing ones. Useful for locked templates where tag structure is fixed but tag selection can change. Example: pre-defined email template where placeholders exist but sender can swap which attributes fill them.

Displays helpful usage tips/hints to users within the editor interface. Tips can explain keyboard shortcuts, formatting syntax (WhatsApp *bold*), or dynamic content usage. Use slot 'tipOptions' to provide custom tip content. Helpful for first-time users or complex features.
valueFormat.example: tip-status // Shows usage tips in UI

valueFormat.notes: Configures special character support (©, ®, ™, etc). When enabled=true, shows special character picker. Provide optional 'list' array to customize available characters. Useful for legal/marketing content requiring trademark symbols. Characters can be highlighted with isHighlightCharactersEnabled.

When true, visually highlights special characters (from specialCharacters.list) in the editor. Helps users identify non-standard characters that might cause encoding issues in SMS or affect character count. Essential for multi-language or SMS campaigns where special chars consume extra space.

Automatically detects and highlights URLs in the text content. URLs become clickable and visually distinct. Detection uses urlPatternRegex if provided. Useful for email/SMS editors where link tracking or shortening is needed. Combine with @onShortenUrlClick event for URL shortening workflows.

Enables WhatsApp markdown-style formatting: *bold*, _italic_, ~strikethrough~, ```monospace```. When enabled, text wrapped in these symbols will be formatted in WhatsApp messages. Critical for WhatsApp Business API campaigns where formatting must match WhatsApp's syntax. Shows formatting hints to users.

emojiButtonStatus.description: Show emoji picker button - replaces V1 hasEmoji

valueFormat.notes: Shows emoji picker button in toolbar. Replaces V1's hasEmoji prop. When clicked, opens emoji selector allowing users to insert emojis into content. Essential for social media posts, WhatsApp messages, or casual communication channels. Emojis can affect character count in SMS.
valueFormat.example: emoji-button-status // Shows emoji picker in toolbar

valueFormat.notes: Enables advanced dynamic content features like nested attributes, conditional rendering, or complex data structures. When true, dynamic content picker shows extended UI with more options. Use dynamicContentBoxProps to configure the extended picker. For enterprise-level templating with complex data models.

dynamicContentBoxProps.description: Props for dynamic content selection box

valueFormat.notes: Configuration for the dynamic content selection dropdown/modal. searchable=true adds search box (use when >20 attributes), grouped=true shows category groups, maxHeight limits dropdown height. Essential for large attribute lists to maintain usability. Works with isExtendedDynamicContent for advanced features.
valueFormat.typescript: { searchable?: boolean; grouped?: boolean; maxHeight?: number; }

usedDynamicContent.description: Track which dynamic content is used

valueFormat.notes: Array tracking which dynamic content tags are currently in the message. Updates automatically as tags are added/removed. Use to show 'used attributes' list in UI, validate required attributes are present, or analyze attribute usage patterns. Emitted via @markedTags event.

Array of attribute values to mark as errors in the editor. Tags in this list will be visually highlighted with error styling. Use for invalid/undefined attributes, deprecated fields, or tags that failed validation. Critical for preventing message delivery failures from bad attribute references.

Array of attribute values to mark with warning styling. Use for deprecated but still functional attributes, optional fields that might be empty, or attributes with potential issues. Warns users without blocking submission. Softer than errorTags.

Custom character counting logic or component to replace default counter. Use when standard counting doesn't fit your needs (e.g., Unicode normalization, special character weighting, GSM-7 encoding for SMS). Provide component or config object with counting function.

Custom label text displayed in the editor footer. Appears when footerOptions includes 'label'. Use to provide context-specific information: 'SMS segments used', 'Characters remaining', 'Estimated send cost'. Shown alongside counter if both are enabled.

Custom regular expression for detecting URLs in text. Default regex catches http/https URLs. Override to match custom URL formats, internal links, or specific domains. Used with isHighlightUrlEnabled to identify clickable links. Affects URL shortening and tracking features.

Allows uploading images as fallback values for dynamic content. When user clicks on a dynamic tag, they can upload an image instead of text. Useful for personalized product images, profile pictures, or visual content in templates. Image URLs become fallback values.
valueFormat.example: is-upload-fallback // Allow image uploads for fallbacks

valueFormat.notes: Controls when fallback editor UI is shown. 'always' shows fallback input permanently, 'onHover' reveals it when hovering over dynamic tags, 'onClick' shows modal when tag is clicked. Choose based on UX: onClick is cleaner for many tags, always is better for visibility.

Array of toolbar button names to disable (greyed out, not clickable). Use to restrict certain formatting based on context: disable 'link' for SMS, disable 'emoji' for formal emails. More granular than omitting from toolbarOptions - buttons still visible but disabled.

dynamicContentStates.description: State configuration for dynamic content tags

valueFormat.notes: Maps each dynamic content tag to a visual state (default/warning/error). More flexible than errorTags/warningTags arrays. Use for per-tag validation states: show 'email' as warning if optional, 'deleted_field' as error. State affects tag styling in editor.

purifyObject.description: Emitted with detailed purified content object
purifyObject.payload: { text: string, html: string, tags: Array }

markedTags.description: Emitted with list of used tags

addDynamicAttribute.description: Emitted when new dynamic attribute is added

onShortenUrlClick.description: Emitted when URL shortening is requested

closeAllEmojiPickers.description: Emitted to close all emoji pickers

withValidation.title: Rich Text with Character Limit
withValidation.description: Editor with validation and helper text
withValidation.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';

const content = ref('');
const maxLength = 500;

const state = computed(() => {
  const length = content.value.replace(/<[^>]*>/g, '').length;
  if (length === 0) return 'error';
  if (length > maxLength) return 'error';
  if (length > maxLength * 0.9) return 'warning';
  return 'default';
});

const helperText = computed(() => {
  const length = content.value.replace(/<[^>]*>/g, '').length;
  return `${length}/${maxLength} characters`;
});
</script>

<template>
  <InRichTextInput
    id="limited-editor"
    name="limited-editor"
    v-model="content"
    label-text="Short Description"
    :state="state"
    :helper-text="helperText"
    helper-text-validation-config-status
    :helper-text-validation-config="{ maxLength }"
  />
</template>

<script setup>
import { ref } from 'vue';
import { InRichTextInput } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const emailTemplate = ref('');

const customerFields = [
  { id: 'first_name', text: 'First Name', value: '{{first_name}}' },
  { id: 'last_name', text: 'Last Name', value: '{{last_name}}' },
  { id: 'email', text: 'Email Address', value: '{{email}}' },
  { id: 'phone', text: 'Phone Number', value: '{{phone}}' },
  { id: 'company', text: 'Company Name', value: '{{company}}' },
  { id: 'order_id', text: 'Order ID', value: '{{order_id}}' }
];

const dynamicContentBoxProps = {
  searchable: true,
  grouped: true,
  groups: {
    'Customer': ['first_name', 'last_name', 'email', 'phone'],
    'Business': ['company', 'order_id']
  }
};

const handleSave = async () => {
  const response = await fetch('/api/email-templates', {
    method: 'POST',
    body: JSON.stringify({
      content: emailTemplate.value
    })
  });
};
</script>

<template>
  <InRichTextInput
    id="email-template"
    name="email-template"
    v-model="emailTemplate"
    label-text="Email Template"
    dynamic-content-status
    :dynamic-content-list="customerFields"
    :dynamic-content-box-props="dynamicContentBoxProps"
    dynamic-content-box-label="Insert Customer Field"
  />

implementationPatterns.description: Content editor for blog posts with media
implementationPatterns.code:
<script setup>
import { ref } from 'vue';
import { InRichTextInput } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const postContent = ref('');
const isDraft = ref(true);

const toolbarConfig = {
  bold: true,
  italic: true,
  underline: true,
  heading: true,
  bulletList: true,
  orderedList: true,
  link: true,
  image: true,
  code: true
};

const autoSave = async () => {
  if (!isDraft.value) return;
  
  await fetch('/api/posts/autosave', {
    method: 'POST',
    body: JSON.stringify({
      content: postContent.value,
      timestamp: Date.now()
    })
  });
};

// Auto-save every 30 seconds
setInterval(autoSave, 30000);
</script>

<template>
  <InRichTextInput
    id="blog-editor"
    name="blog-editor"
    v-model="postContent"
    label-text="Post Content"
    placeholder="Write your blog post..."
    :toolbar="toolbarConfig"
  />
</template>
implementationPatterns.when: Building CMS or blogging platforms

implementationPatterns.name: SMS Message Editor
implementationPatterns.description: Character-limited editor for SMS with merge tags
implementationPatterns.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';
import { InRichTextInput } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const smsContent = ref('');
const maxChars = 160;

const mergeTags = [
  { id: 'name', text: 'Name', value: '{{name}}' },
  { id: 'code', text: 'Verification Code', value: '{{code}}' },
  { id: 'link', text: 'Link', value: '{{link}}' }
];

const charCount = computed(() => {
  // Remove HTML tags and count merge tags as their max length
  let text = smsContent.value.replace(/<[^>]*>/g, '');
  text = text.replace(/{{name}}/g, 'X'.repeat(50));
  text = text.replace(/{{code}}/g, 'X'.repeat(6));
  text = text.replace(/{{link}}/g, 'X'.repeat(100));
  return text.length;
});

const state = computed(() => {
  if (charCount.value > maxChars) return 'error';
  if (charCount.value > maxChars * 0.9) return 'warning';
  return 'default';
});

const helperText = computed(() => {
  const remaining = maxChars - charCount.value;
  if (remaining < 0) return `Over limit by ${Math.abs(remaining)} characters`;
  return `${remaining} characters remaining`;
});
</script>

<template>
  <InRichTextInput
    id="sms-editor"
    name="sms-editor"
    v-model="smsContent"
    label-text="SMS Message"
    dynamic-content-status
    :dynamic-content-list="mergeTags"
    :state="state"
    :helper-text="helperText"
    :toolbar="{ bold: false, italic: false, link: false }"
  />
</template>
implementationPatterns.when: Building SMS marketing or notification systems

InSelect.name: InSelect
InSelect.title: In Select

optionValidationText.default: Enter a valid value to continue.

characterLimitValidationText.default: Enter a value between 1 and 10 characters to continue.

metadata.description: Dropdown select component with search, lazy loading, nested options, and custom option creation. Supports single selection with extensive customization.

accessibility.notes: Supports keyboard navigation (Tab, Enter, Arrow keys, Escape), proper label association, focus management, and state announcements. Prevents default behavior for arrow keys to improve accessibility.

performance.notes: Lazy loading support reduces initial render cost for large option lists. Search functionality can be optimized with debouncing. Flattens nested options for efficient lookups. Uses lodash.clonedeep for option manipulation.

features.createOption: Allow users to create custom options
features.dynamicPosition: Auto-adjust dropdown position based on viewport

useCases: User selection with search and lazy loading

export default {
  components: { InSelect },
  data() {
    return {
      statusOptions: [
        { text: 'Active', value: 'active' },
        { text: 'Pending', value: 'pending' },
        { text: 'Inactive', value: 'inactive' }
      ],
      selectedStatus: [] // Empty = no selection
    };

      this.selectedStatus = [option]; // CRITICAL: Always array!

};
</script>

examples.title: With Search and Icons
examples.description: Searchable dropdown with icons
examples.code:
<template>
  <InSelect
    id="country-select"
    label-text="Country"
    placeholder-text="Search countries..."
    :search-status="true"
    :options="countryOptions"
    :value="selectedCountry"
    @optionClick="handleSelect"
    @search="handleSearch" />
</template>

<script>
import { InSelect } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InSelect },
  data() {
    return {
      allCountries: [
        { text: 'United States', value: 'US', icon: 'flag-us' },
        { text: 'United Kingdom', value: 'UK', icon: 'flag-uk' },
        { text: 'Turkey', value: 'TR', icon: 'flag-tr' },
        // ... more countries
      ],
      countryOptions: [],
      selectedCountry: []
    };
  },
  created() {
    this.countryOptions = this.allCountries;
  },
  methods: {
    handleSelect(option) {
      this.selectedCountry = [option];
    },
    handleSearch(query) {
      if (!query) {
        this.countryOptions = this.allCountries;
        return;
      }
      this.countryOptions = this.allCountries.filter(country =>
        country.text.toLowerCase().includes(query.toLowerCase())
      );
    }
  }
};
</script>

examples.title: Lazy Loading with Infinite Scroll
examples.description: Load options on scroll for large datasets
examples.code:
<template>
  <InSelect
    id="user-select"
    label-text="Select User"
    :search-status="true"
    :lazy-load="true"
    :lazy-load-search="true"
    :fetch-page="currentPage"
    :options="users"
    :value="selectedUser"
    :loading-state="isLoading"
    @optionClick="handleSelect"
    @search="handleSearch"
    @endScroll="loadMore" />
</template>

<script>
import { InSelect } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

export default {
  components: { InSelect },
  data() {
    return {
      users: [],
      selectedUser: [],
      currentPage: 1,
      isLoading: false,
      searchQuery: ''
    };
  },
  created() {
    this.loadUsers();
  },
  methods: {
    async loadUsers() {
      this.isLoading = true;
      try {
        const response = await fetch(
          `/api/users?page=${this.currentPage}&search=${this.searchQuery}`
        );
        const data = await response.json();
        
        // Transform API response to select format
        const newUsers = data.users.map(u => ({
          text: u.name,
          value: u.id,
          description: u.email
        }));
        
        this.users = [...this.users, ...newUsers];
      } finally {
        this.isLoading = false;
      }
    },
    
    loadMore() {
      this.currentPage++;
      this.loadUsers();
    },
    
    handleSearch(query) {
      this.searchQuery = query;
      this.currentPage = 1;
      this.users = []; // Clear existing
      this.loadUsers();
    },
    
    handleSelect(option) {
      this.selectedUser = [option];
    }
  }
};
</script>

commonMistakes.mistake: Using 'label' instead of 'text' in options
commonMistakes.why: Component expects 'text' property
commonMistakes.impact: Options won't display correctly
commonMistakes.fix: Use { text: 'Display', value: 'val' } format

commonMistakes.mistake: Passing single value instead of array
commonMistakes.why: InSelect value prop expects array format
commonMistakes.impact: Component won't work, type error
commonMistakes.fix: Wrap in array: [{ text: 'X', value: 'x' }]

commonMistakes.mistake: Not handling empty selection
commonMistakes.why: value array can be empty
commonMistakes.impact: Errors when accessing value[0]
commonMistakes.fix: Check length before accessing: value[0]?.value

import { ref } from 'vue';
import { InSelect } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const options = [
  { text: 'Option 1', value: 1 },
  { text: 'Option 2', value: 2 },
  { text: 'Option 3', value: 3 }
];

const selected = ref([]);
</script>

<template>
  <InSelect
    id="basic-select"
    label-text="Choose an option"
    :options="options"
    :value="selected"
    @change="selected = $event"
  />
</template>

searchableSelect.title: Searchable Select
searchableSelect.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';

const allCountries = ref([...]);
const searchQuery = ref('');
const selected = ref([]);

const filteredOptions = computed(() => {
  if (!searchQuery.value) return allCountries.value;
  return allCountries.value.filter(c => 
    c.text.toLowerCase().includes(searchQuery.value.toLowerCase())
  );
});
</script>

<template>
  <InSelect
    label-text="Country"
    search-status
    :options="filteredOptions"
    :value="selected"
    @search="searchQuery = $event"
    @change="selected = $event"
  />
</template>

validatedSelect.title: Select with Validation
validatedSelect.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';

const selected = ref([]);

const state = computed(() => {
  if (selected.value.length === 0) return 'error';
  return 'success';
});

const stateMessage = computed(() => 
  selected.value.length === 0 ? 'Please select an option' : ''
);
</script>

<template>
  <InSelect
    label-text="Required Field *"
    :options="options"
    :value="selected"
    :state="state"
    :state-message="stateMessage"
    @change="selected = $event"
  />
</template>

styling.notes: Use CSS variables for theming. Component automatically handles focus states.

implementationPatterns.name: Form Field Select
implementationPatterns.description: Select as part of form with validation
implementationPatterns.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';
import { InSelect } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const formData = ref({
  country: [],
  status: []
});

const countries = [
  { text: 'Turkey', value: 'TR' },
  { text: 'USA', value: 'US' },
  { text: 'UK', value: 'GB' }
];

const validateForm = () => {
  return formData.value.country.length > 0 && 
         formData.value.status.length > 0;
};
</script>

<template>
  <form @submit.prevent="handleSubmit">
    <InSelect
      id="country"
      label-text="Country *"
      :options="countries"
      :value="formData.country"
      :state="formData.country.length === 0 ? 'error' : 'default'"
      @change="formData.country = $event"
    />
    
    <button :disabled="!validateForm()" type="submit">
      Submit
    </button>
  </form>
</template>
implementationPatterns.when: Building forms with required select fields

implementationPatterns.name: Dynamic Options Select
implementationPatterns.description: Load options from API
implementationPatterns.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, onMounted } from 'vue';
import { InSelect } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const options = ref([]);
const selected = ref([]);
const loading = ref(false);

const loadOptions = async () => {
  loading.value = true;
  try {
    const response = await fetch('/api/options');
    const data = await response.json();
    options.value = data.map(item => ({
      text: item.name,
      value: item.id
    }));
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Failed to load options:', error);
  } finally {
    loading.value = false;
  }
};

onMounted(() => {
  loadOptions();
});
</script>

<template>
  <InSelect
    label-text="Select Item"
    :options="options"
    :value="selected"
    :loading-status="loading"
    @change="selected = $event"
  />
</template>
implementationPatterns.when: Options come from API/database

InSidebarV2.name: InSidebarV2
InSidebarV2.title: In Sidebar

metadata.description: Sidebar navigation component with collapsible items

InSidebarV2.typeDefs:
import { DefineComponent } from 'vue';

/**
 * Sidebar navigation item structure.
 */
export interface SidebarItem {
  /**
   * Unique identifier for the sidebar item.
   * Used for navigation and event handling.
   */
  id: string;

  /**
   * Display label for the sidebar item.
   */
  label: string;

  /**
   * Optional icon name to display with the item.
   * Icon names should match InIcons component icon set.
   *
   * @example icon="home"
   * @example icon="users"
   * @example icon="settings"
   */
  icon?: string;

  /**
   * Whether this item is currently active/selected.
   * Active items are highlighted.
   *
   * @default false
   */
  active?: boolean;

  /**
   * Nested child items for hierarchical navigation.
   * Creates expandable/collapsible sub-sections.
   *
   * @example
   * children: [
   *   { id: 'all-users', label: 'All Users' },
   *   { id: 'add-user', label: 'Add User' }
   * ]
   */
  children?: SidebarItem[];

  /**
   * Whether this item is disabled.
   * Disabled items are visible but not clickable.
   *
   * @default false
   */
  disabled?: boolean;

  /**
   * Badge count to display on the item.
   * Useful for showing notification counts or item counts.
   *
   * @example badge="5"
   * @example :badge="unreadCount"
   */
  badge?: string | number;

  /**
   * Custom CSS class to apply to this item.
   *
   * @example customClass="danger"
   * @example customClass="highlighted"
   */
  customClass?: string;
}

/**
 * InSidebarV2 component props.
 */
export interface InSidebarV2Props {
  /**
   * Unique identifier for the sidebar element.
   *
   * @required
   * @example id="main-sidebar"
   * @example id="admin-nav"
   */
  id: string;

  /**
   * Array of navigation items to display.
   * Supports nested items via children property.
   *
   * @required
   * @example
   * :items="[
   *   { id: 'dashboard', label: 'Dashboard', icon: 'home', active: true },
   *   { id: 'users', label: 'Users', icon: 'users' },
   *   { id: 'settings', label: 'Settings', icon: 'settings' }
   * ]"
   *
   * @example
   * // With nested items
   * :items="[
   *   { id: 'dashboard', label: 'Dashboard', icon: 'home' },
   *   {
   *     id: 'users',
   *     label: 'Users',
   *     icon: 'users',
   *     children: [
   *       { id: 'all-users', label: 'All Users' },
   *       { id: 'add-user', label: 'Add User' }
   *     ]
   *   }
   * ]"
   */
  items: SidebarItem[];

  /**
   * Controls the collapsed state of the sidebar.
   * When true, shows only icons; labels are hidden.
   *
   * @default false
   * @example :collapsed="isSidebarCollapsed"
   */
  collapsed?: boolean;

  /**
   * Width of the sidebar in pixels.
   * Only applies when sidebar is not collapsed.
   *
   * @default 240
   * @example :width="280"
   * @example :width="320"
   */
  width?: number;

  /**
   * Background color theme for the sidebar.
   *
   * @default 'dark'
   * @example theme="dark"
   * @example theme="light"
   */
  theme?: 'dark' | 'light';

  /**
   * Whether to show tooltips for items when collapsed.
   * Helpful for showing full labels when only icons are visible.
   *
   * @default true
   * @example :show-tooltips="true"
   */
  showTooltips?: boolean;
}

/**
 * Event handler types for InSidebarV2.
 */
export interface InSidebarV2EventHandlers {
  /**
   * Handler for item click event.
   * Emitted when a sidebar item is clicked.
   *
   * @param itemId - The id of the clicked item
   * @example
   * const handleItemClick = (itemId: string) => {
   *   console.log('Navigate to:', itemId);
   *   router.push({ name: itemId });
   * }
   */
  onItemClick?: (itemId: string) => void;

  /**
   * Handler for toggle event.
   * Emitted when sidebar collapse state changes.
   *
   * @param collapsed - New collapsed state
   * @example
   * const handleToggle = (collapsed: boolean) => {
   *   isSidebarCollapsed.value = collapsed;
   * }
   */
  onToggle?: (collapsed: boolean) => void;

  /**
   * Handler for expand/collapse of nested items.
   * Emitted when a parent item with children is clicked.
   *
   * @param itemId - The id of the parent item
   * @param expanded - Whether the item is now expanded
   * @example
   * const handleExpand = (itemId: string, expanded: boolean) => {
   *   console.log(`Item ${itemId} is ${expanded ? 'expanded' : 'collapsed'}`);
   * }
   */
  onExpand?: (itemId: string, expanded: boolean) => void;
}

/**
 * InSidebarV2 Component
 *
 * Responsive sidebar navigation component with collapsible sections,
 * nested items, icons, active state management, and smooth animations.
 *
 * @example
 * // Basic sidebar
 * <InSidebarV2
 *   id="nav"
 *   :items="[
 *     { id: 'home', label: 'Home', icon: 'home', active: true },
 *     { id: 'about', label: 'About', icon: 'info' },
 *     { id: 'contact', label: 'Contact', icon: 'mail' }
 *   ]"
 *   @item-click="navigate"
 * />
 *
 * @example
 * // Collapsible sidebar
 * <template>
 *   <InSidebarV2
 *     id="main-sidebar"
 *     :items="navItems"
 *     :collapsed="isCollapsed"
 *     :width="280"
 *     @item-click="handleNavigation"
 *     @toggle="isCollapsed = $event"
 *   />
 *
 *   <button @click="isCollapsed = !isCollapsed">
 *     Toggle Sidebar
 *   </button>
 * </template>
 *
 * @example
 * // With nested navigation
 * <InSidebarV2
 *   id="admin-nav"
 *   :items="[
 *     { id: 'dashboard', label: 'Dashboard', icon: 'home' },
 *     {
 *       id: 'users',
 *       label: 'Users',
 *       icon: 'users',
 *       children: [
 *         { id: 'all-users', label: 'All Users' },
 *         { id: 'add-user', label: 'Add User' },
 *         { id: 'roles', label: 'Roles' }
 *       ]
 *     },
 *     {
 *       id: 'content',
 *       label: 'Content',
 *       icon: 'file-text',
 *       children: [
 *         { id: 'posts', label: 'Posts' },
 *         { id: 'pages', label: 'Pages' }
 *       ]
 *     }
 *   ]"
 *   @item-click="navigateTo"
 * />
 *
 * @example
 * // With badges and active state
 * <template>
 *   <InSidebarV2
 *     id="nav"
 *     :items="navWithBadges"
 *     @item-click="setActive"
 *   />
 * </template>
 *
 * <script setup>
 * import { ref, computed } from 'vue';
 *
 * const activeItemId = ref('dashboard');
 * const unreadMessages = ref(5);
 *
 * const navWithBadges = computed(() => [
 *   {
 *     id: 'dashboard',
 *     label: 'Dashboard',
 *     icon: 'home',
 *     active: activeItemId.value === 'dashboard'
 *   },
 *   {
 *     id: 'messages',
 *     label: 'Messages',
 *     icon: 'mail',
 *     badge: unreadMessages.value,
 *     active: activeItemId.value === 'messages'
 *   }
 * ]);
 *
 * const setActive = (itemId) => {
 *   activeItemId.value = itemId;
 *   router.push({ name: itemId });
 * };
 * </script>
 *
 * @example
 * // TypeScript usage
 * import type { InSidebarV2EventHandlers, SidebarItem } from './InSidebarV2';
 *
 * const items: SidebarItem[] = [
 *   { id: 'home', label: 'Home', icon: 'home', active: true },
 *   { id: 'settings', label: 'Settings', icon: 'settings', badge: '3' }
 * ];
 *
 * const handlers: InSidebarV2EventHandlers = {
 *   onItemClick: (itemId) => console.log('Clicked:', itemId),
 *   onToggle: (collapsed) => console.log('Collapsed:', collapsed)
 * };
 * </script>
 */
declare const InSidebarV2: DefineComponent<InSidebarV2Props>;

export default InSidebarV2;

examples.title: Complete Sidebar with Navigation
examples.description: Full example with routes, search, and navigation
examples.code:
<script setup>
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';
import { useRouter, useRoute } from 'vue-router';
import { InSidebarV2 } from '@useinsider/design-system-vue';

const router = useRouter();
const route = useRoute();

const unreadCount = ref(5);
const navigationRoutes = computed(() => [
  { 
    id: 'dashboard', 
    label: 'Dashboard', 
    path: '/', 
    icon: 'home',
    active: route.path === '/'
  },
  { 
    id: 'inbox', 
    label: 'Inbox', 
    path: '/inbox', 
    icon: 'mail',
    badge: unreadCount.value,
    active: route.path === '/inbox'
  },
  {
    id: 'admin',
    label: 'Administration',
    path: '/admin',
    icon: 'lock',
    children: [
      { id: 'users', label: 'Users', path: '/admin/users' },
      { id: 'settings', label: 'Settings', path: '/admin/settings' }
    ]
  }
]);

const handleNavigate = (routeObj) => {
  router.push(routeObj.path);
};
</script>

<template>
  <InSidebarV2 
    :routes="navigationRoutes"
    @navigate="handleNavigate"
  />
</template>

examples.title: Sidebar with Search Functionality
examples.description: Sidebar with debounced search and recent searches
examples.code:
<script setup>
import { ref } from 'vue';
import { debounce } from 'lodash-es';

const searchQuery = ref('');
const searchResults = ref([]);
const recentSearches = ref(
  JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem('recentSearches') || '[]')
);

const performSearch = async (query) => {
  if (!query) {
    searchResults.value = [];
    return;
  }
  
  // Simulate API call
  const results = await api.search(query);
  searchResults.value = results.slice(0, 10);
  
  // Add to recent searches
  const updated = [query, ...recentSearches.value.filter(s => s !== query)].slice(0, 10);
  recentSearches.value = updated;
  localStorage.setItem('recentSearches', JSON.stringify(updated));
};

const debouncedSearch = debounce(performSearch, 300);

const handleSearch = (query) => {
  searchQuery.value = query;
  debouncedSearch(query);
};

const handleSearchResultClick = (result) => {
  router.push(result.path);
};
</script>

<template>
  <InSidebarV2 
    :routes="routes"
    :search-results="searchResults"
    :recent-searches="recentSearches"
    @search="handleSearch"
    @search-result-click="handleSearchResultClick"
  />
</template>

commonMistakes.title: Not providing required routes prop

commonMistakes.title: Missing 'id' in route objects
commonMistakes.description: Each route must have unique id for tracking and state management
commonMistakes.impact: Active route tracking fails, navigation events don't work properly

commonMistakes.description: Routes should be defined once, not recreated in template

<InSidebarV2 :routes="routes" />

[{ id: 'admin', label: 'Admin', path: '/admin', icon: 'lock', children: [{ id: 'users', label: 'Users', path: '/admin/users' }, { id: 'roles', label: 'Roles', path: '/admin/roles' }] }]

commonMistakes.mistake: Missing required 'id' property in route objects
commonMistakes.impact: Route tracking and active state don't work, events fail
commonMistakes.fix: Always provide unique id: { id: 'dashboard', label: 'Dashboard', path: '/' }

commonMistakes.mistake: Using duplicate route IDs
commonMistakes.impact: Active state conflicts, navigation breaks
commonMistakes.fix: Ensure each route has unique id, including nested routes

commonMistakes.mistake: Not providing path property
commonMistakes.impact: Navigation doesn't work, routes not clickable
commonMistakes.fix: Always include path: { id: 'home', label: 'Home', path: '/' }

commonMistakes.mistake: Deep nesting (>3 levels)
commonMistakes.impact: Poor UX, complex navigation structure
commonMistakes.fix: Keep navigation hierarchy shallow (max 2 levels recommended)

bestPractices.description: Mark current route as active for clear navigation context
bestPractices.benefit: Clear visual feedback, better orientation, improved UX

bestPractices.description: Use debounced search to reduce API calls and improve performance

performanceNotes.description: Rendering 50+ routes at once can impact initial load time.

performanceNotes.description: Search triggers on every keystroke without debouncing causes excessive API calls.

performanceNotes.description: Storing unlimited recent searches in localStorage can cause performance issues.

commonMistakes.mistake: Not hiding skeleton after data loads
commonMistakes.why: Skeleton state isn't toggled when data arrives
commonMistakes.impact: Critical - users can't see content, skeleton blocks everything
commonMistakes.fix: Set status=false or use v-if with loading state

commonMistakes.mistake: Skeleton dimensions don't match content
commonMistakes.why: Using arbitrary sizes instead of measuring actual content
commonMistakes.impact: Layout shift when skeleton replaced with content - jarring UX
commonMistakes.fix: Measure actual content dimensions and use same sizes

commonMistakes.mistake: Single skeleton for list of items
commonMistakes.why: Doesn't indicate multiple items are loading
commonMistakes.impact: Users don't know list is loading vs single item
commonMistakes.fix: Show 3-5 skeleton items for lists/collections

commonMistakes.mistake: Overly complex skeleton animations
commonMistakes.why: Custom animations distract or cause performance issues
commonMistakes.impact: Distracting UX, possible performance degradation
commonMistakes.fix: Use default shimmer/pulse animation, keep it subtle
commonMistakes.example:
// Avoid complex custom animations
// Use default skeleton animation instead

valueFormat.notes: Controls skeleton visibility. When true (default), shows skeleton loader. When false, hides skeleton (typically showing actual content instead). Use to toggle between loading and loaded states.
valueFormat.example:
true // Show skeleton (loading)
false // Hide skeleton (content loaded)

commonMistakes.mistake: Not toggling status when data loads
commonMistakes.why: Skeleton should disappear when real content is available
commonMistakes.impact: Users see skeleton indefinitely, can't access actual content
commonMistakes.fix: Set status=false after data successfully loads

valueFormat.notes: Defines skeleton dimensions and shape. Required prop. Contains width, height, and optional shape properties. Use to match skeleton to actual content layout (text lines, avatars, cards, etc.).
valueFormat.typescript:
{
  width?: string | number; // CSS width (px, %, rem, etc.)
  height?: string | number; // CSS height
  minWidth?: string | number; // Min width
  maxWidth?: string | number; // Max width
  borderRadius?: string | number; // Border radius for rounded skeletons
}

commonMistakes.mistake: Not matching skeleton size to actual content
commonMistakes.why: Causes layout shift when skeleton is replaced with content
commonMistakes.impact: Poor UX - content jumps/shifts causing disorientation
commonMistakes.fix: Measure actual content dimensions and use same sizes in skeleton

valueFormat.notes: Optional identifier for the skeleton. Useful for debugging, tracking, or applying custom styles to specific skeleton instances.

bestPractices.title: Match Skeleton Dimensions to Actual Content
bestPractices.description: Measure and match skeleton sizes to prevent layout shift
bestPractices.reasoning: Layout shift (CLS) is poor UX and bad for SEO. Matching skeleton to content creates seamless transition and professional experience.

bestPractices.title: Show Multiple Skeleton Items for Lists
bestPractices.description: Display 3-5 skeleton items to indicate list/collection
bestPractices.reasoning: Single skeleton doesn't indicate list/multiple items. 3-5 skeletons clearly show collection is loading and set expectations.

bestPractices.title: Always Toggle status When Data Loads
bestPractices.description: Set status=false or use v-if to hide skeleton when content ready
bestPractices.reasoning: Forgetting to hide skeleton is critical bug. Users can't access content. Always tie skeleton visibility to loading state.

bestPractices.title: Use Appropriate Shapes for Content Type
bestPractices.description: Circles for avatars, rectangles for text, rounded for cards
bestPractices.reasoning: Shape hints at content type. Circles suggest avatars/icons, rectangles suggest text. Helps users anticipate what's loading.

performanceNotes.description: Too many skeleton elements impact render performance
performanceNotes.recommendation: Limit to 5-10 skeleton items max. For long lists, use virtualization or lazy loading instead of 100+ skeletons.
performanceNotes.impact: Medium: 50+ skeleton elements can slow rendering on low-end devices

performanceNotes.description: CSS shimmer animations use GPU, can impact battery/performance
performanceNotes.recommendation: Use subtle animations. Consider disabling animations on low-power mode or older devices using prefers-reduced-motion.
performanceNotes.impact: Low: Only affects battery life on mobile, not critical

accessibilityNotes.description: Screen readers should announce loading state
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Wrap skeleton in aria-live='polite' region or use aria-busy='true' on parent to announce loading to screen readers.

accessibilityNotes.description: Respect user's motion preferences for animations
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Disable shimmer/pulse animations when user has prefers-reduced-motion enabled.

accessibilityNotes.description: Skeleton should be marked as decorative for screen readers
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Add aria-hidden='true' to skeleton elements so screen readers skip them and only announce loading state via parent.

commonMistakes.mistake: Not providing attributeList with dynamicContentSupport
Wrong delimiter format
Using invalid without invalidMessage
commonMistakes.solution: Always provide invalid-message with invalid prop

commonMistakes.mistake: Not handling @purify event
commonMistakes.solution: Use @purify to get clean content for submission

valueFormat.notes: Text content including dynamic attribute tags. Tags are wrapped in delimiters (default: {{attribute}}). Use v-model for two-way binding. Example: 'Hello {{first_name}}, welcome!' becomes 'Hello John, welcome!' when rendered. Listen to @purify event for sanitized output.

CRITICAL: Defines insertable dynamic attributes (like merge tags). Each attribute needs 'label' (shown in dropdown) and 'value' (inserted into text). Optional 'category' for grouping. Used with dynamicContentSupport=true. Example: user selects 'First Name' from dropdown, {{first_name}} gets inserted into text.
valueFormat.typescript: Array<{ label: string; value: string; category?: string; }>

commonMistakes.mistake: Not providing attributeList when dynamicContentSupport is true
commonMistakes.impact: No attributes available in dropdown, users can't insert dynamic content
commonMistakes.fix: Always provide :attribute-list with available attributes when dynamic-content-support is enabled

valueFormat.notes: Master switch for dynamic attribute functionality. When true, shows attribute dropdown button and allows inserting dynamic tags into text. Requires attributeList to be provided. Used for personalized messages, email templates, SMS campaigns with merge fields.

Centralized validation rules object. maxLength enforces character limit (shows counter), minLength requires minimum text, pattern validates format (regex), required makes field mandatory. Validation errors trigger invalid state and messages.
valueFormat.typescript: { maxLength?: number; minLength?: number; pattern?: RegExp; required?: boolean; }

fallBackText.description: Default fallback text for dynamic attributes

valueFormat.notes: Default value shown when dynamic attribute is empty/undefined. Critical for email/SMS where missing data shouldn't break templates. Example: if {{first_name}} is empty and fallBackText='Customer', message shows 'Hello Customer' instead of 'Hello '.
Label text shown above fallback input field when user clicks on dynamic attribute tag. Helps users understand they're setting a default value. Example: 'Default value if empty' or 'Fallback text'.

fallBackDisabledCharacters.description: Characters not allowed in fallback text

valueFormat.notes: Blacklist of characters that cannot be used in fallback values. Useful for preventing XSS attacks or enforcing data format. Example: ['<', '>', '&'] prevents HTML injection. Shows validation error if user types forbidden character.

valueFormat.structure: Array with start and end delimiter
valueFormat.notes: Defines how dynamic attributes are wrapped in text. Default is ['{{', '}}'] for {{attribute}}. Can customize for different templating syntaxes like ['<<', '>>'] or ['${', '}']. MUST be 2-element array [opening, closing].

Shows emoji picker button that allows users to insert emojis into text. Useful for social media posts, marketing messages, or casual communication. Emoji picker includes categories and search functionality.

Changes input to tag-based interface where each entry becomes a removable chip/tag. Instead of free text, users add discrete tags. Useful for categories, keywords, or multiple selections. Works with tagsLimit to restrict count.

Displays character count below input (e.g., '45/160'). Count respects textValidateConfig.maxLength. Use countDynamicContentForValidation to decide if dynamic tags count toward limit. Essential for SMS (160 char) or Twitter-like interfaces.

Maximum tags when isTagContainer=true. 0 (default) means unlimited. When limit reached, users cannot add more tags and get warning message. Useful for enforcing business rules like 'max 5 categories'.
Textarea height in rows (visible lines). Default is 1 (single line). Use 3-5 for multi-line text like descriptions, 1 for compact inputs. Actual textarea height = rowLength * line-height.

Style/behavior of attribute selector dropdown. 'text' (default) for simple list, 'grouped' organizes by category, 'searchable' adds search box. Use 'searchable' when attributeList has 10+ items for better UX.

Enables adding custom attributes not in attributeList. Shows 'Create new' option in dropdown when user types unknown attribute. New attributes can be saved dynamically. Use with caution - consider strictAddMode for controlled environments.

When true, users can ONLY select from attributeList - no free text or new attributes allowed. Enforces strict data integrity. Use for production email templates where only validated attributes are safe. Default true for security.

countDynamicContentForValidation.description: Include dynamic content in character count

valueFormat.notes: When true, dynamic tags like {{first_name}} count as their placeholder length (e.g., 12 chars). When false, tags count as their rendered value length. Critical for SMS: if counting rendered values, 'Hi {{first_name}}' might exceed 160 chars after rendering.

Help users understand what fallback values are for

bestPractices.description: Prevent users from adding arbitrary attributes

performanceNotes.description: Rendering 100+ attributes in dropdown can slow UI
performanceNotes.recommendation: Categorize attributes (category property) and use grouped dropdown. Limit to 50 attributes or implement search/filtering in dropdown

performanceNotes.description: Calculating estimated length with dynamic attributes on every keystroke
performanceNotes.recommendation: Debounce length calculations (200-300ms). Use @purify event which fires less frequently than @input. Cache attribute max lengths

performanceNotes.description: Opening fallback modal for each attribute click
performanceNotes.recommendation: Modal is lightweight, but limit fallback validation complexity. Use simple character blacklists instead of heavy regex validation

accessibilityNotes.description: Input must have associated label for screen readers

accessibilityNotes.description: Attribute tags must be keyboard accessible and announced
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Component adds role='button' and aria-label to each tag. Tags are keyboard accessible (Tab to focus, Enter/Space to open fallback modal)

accessibilityNotes.description: Dropdown must be keyboard navigable and properly labeled
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Component handles: Enter/Space to open dropdown, Arrow keys to navigate, Enter to select, Escape to close. Dropdown has aria-label='Insert dynamic attribute'

accessibilityNotes.description: Screen readers should announce character count updates
accessibilityNotes.recommendation: Component updates aria-live region with character count. Announces at intervals (every 10% of limit) to avoid spam
